0.title: Yuvraj Singh gets notice as his 'unregistered' Goa villa listed as homestay on Airbnb
0.article_body: Yuvraj Singh got a notice from Goa government for listing his Morjim villa and other properties in the state as homestays on Airbnb, without registering them as such with the relevant authorities. Singh has been asked to appear before the Tourism Department to explain why he shouldn't be punished. The default in registration may lead to a ₹1-lakh fine.

1.title: May you break many stumps: Irfan on Umran Malik's 23rd birthday
1.article_body: Wishing India pacer Umran Malik on his 23rd birthday on Tuesday, Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "May you break many stumps." Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel tweeted, "Happy birthday champ. Live long, wishing all success ahead in life." Robin Uthappa said, "Have a super successful year ahead! Looking forward to watching more of you on the big stage!!"

2.title: Saudi Arabia fans do Ronaldo's 'Siu' celebration after win against Argentina, video viral
2.article_body: A video of Saudi Arabia fans outside the Lusail Stadium doing Cristiano Ronaldo's 'Siu' celebration after Saudi Arabia's 2-1 victory against Argentina in a 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match has gone viral. Saudi Arabia won the match after scoring two goals in the second half. They were trailing 0-1 after the first half.

3.title: Salman Khan's niece Alizeh begins shooting for debut film: Report
3.article_body: Actor Salman Khan's niece Alizeh Agnihotri has reportedly begun shooting for her debut film. As per reports, National Award-winning filmmaker Soumendra Padhi will be directing the film and it will release in 2023. Alizeh is the daughter of Atul and Alvira Agnihotri. Soumendra has worked in projects like 'Budhia Singh: Born to Run' and 'Jamtara'.

4.title: SA20 league brings much-needed rejuvenation to our domestic system: Duminy
4.article_body: Ex-South Africa batter JP Duminy said that the upcoming SA20 league brings much-needed rejuvenation to the country's cricketing domestic system. "The SA20 is an injection into the domestic system which is usually needed in the upliftment...of the cricketing ecosystem," Duminy said. He added, "I think the uniqueness...is...that there are six IPL franchise owners, which is outside of the IPL."

5.title: New bird-like dinosaur fossil with frog remains in stomach discovered in China
5.article_body: A new bird-like dinosaur with the partial skeleton of an ancient frog in the remains of its gut has been unearthed in China. According to researchers, the dinosaur named Daurlong wangi, which lived about 120 million years ago, was a type of mid-sized dromaeosaurid - a group of bird-like predatory dinosaurs. It primarily fed on fish, mammals, and other dinosaurs.

6.title: Iran hits 'terrorist' base in Iraq's Kurdistan Region: Iranian media
6.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards targeted the base of a "separatist terrorist" group in Iraq's autonomous Kurdistan Region with missiles and kamikaze drones on Tuesday, Iran's Tasnim news agency reported. Last week, Iranian rockets and drones hit the headquarters of Iranian Kurdish parties in the region. Tehran accuses Iraq-based Iranian Kurdish groups of fomenting the ongoing unrest in Iran.

7.title: Saudi goalkeeper breaks down after slamming into teammate's head with a flying knee
7.article_body: Saudi Arabia goalkeeper Mohammed Alowais broke down after slamming into his teammate Yasser Alshahrani with a flying knee during their 2022 FIFA World Cup opening match against Argentina. Alshahrani fell down with his head hitting the turf. The match was halted briefly as he received treatment. He was later carried off on stretcher.

8.title: NCLAT stays CCI imposed penalty of ₹169 crore against OYO
8.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Tuesday stayed the penalty of ₹168.88 crore imposed by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) upon OYO. An NCLAT Division Bench, however, directed OYO to deposit 10% of the penalty amount. The CCI had levied the penalty on the hospitality and travel tech firm for alleged anti-competitive practices.

9.title: TN BJP suspends actress Gayathri for 6 months for 'violating party discipline'
9.article_body: BJP Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai on Tuesday announced the suspension of actress Gayathri Raghuramm for six months for "repeatedly violating party discipline and bringing disrepute" to it. Annamalai also barred OBC leader Surya Siva from party events after an audio clip of him in which he was purportedly heard using abusive language against a woman colleague went viral.

10.title: Feel blessed to get my 1st 'Player of the Match' award: India pacer Siraj
10.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' against New Zealand in third T20I, India pacer Mohammed Siraj took to Twitter and wrote, "Thank you everyone for the wishes." He added, "Feel blessed to get my first 'Player of the Match' award and contribute to the team's [series] win. Onwards and upwards from here." Siraj posted bowling figures of 4-0-17-4.

11.title: I felt attack is best defence on this wicket: Hardik Pandya
11.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 30(18) against New Zealand, India skipper Hardik Pandya said that he felt attack was the best defence on the pitch at McLean Park on Tuesday. "We know the kind of bowling attacks they (New Zealand) have, it was very important to get those 10-15 runs extra even though we lost a couple of wickets," Pandya said.

12.title: Principal, 3 teachers arrested after Kerala girl sexually assaulted
12.article_body: Kerala Police has arrested a government school teacher from Tamil Nadu for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl student last week. The school's principal and two other teachers were also arrested for not reporting the incident to the police on time. Police have also seized the main accused's car, which he used to evade his arrest after allegedly committing the crime.

13.title: Tim Hortons plans to open around 120 stores in India in 3 years
13.article_body: Canadian restaurant chain Tim Hortons plans to open around 120 stores in India in the next three years at an investment of up to ₹300 crore, the company’s India CEO Navin Gurnaney said. He added that the company will “build the foundation” with 20 new stores in the first year. Gurnaney mentioned that all the stores will be company-owned.

14.title: Kartik Aaryan is so driven and hard-working: 'Freddy' co-star Alaya F
14.article_body: Actress Alaya F, sharing her experience of working with Kartik Aaryan in the upcoming movie 'Freddy', said she learnt a lot from him. "He's so driven and...hard-working," she added. "Seeing him work and working with him validated my core belief that if you're obsessed with your work...nothing can stop you from achieving everything you want and more," Alaya said.

15.title: It is a dream role: Akshay on playing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj
15.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who'll be portraying Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the upcoming film 'Vedat Marathe Veer Daudale Saat', said he was taken aback when he was offered the role. Calling it a "dream role", the actor said, "It comes with a responsibility." "Also, I'll be working with director Mahesh Manjrekar for...first time and it's going to be an experience," said Akshay.

16.title: Govt invites bids for solar manufacturing under ₹19,500-crore PLI scheme
16.article_body: The state-run Solar Energy Corporation of India is seeking bids from solar manufacturers under the second tranche of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme with a corpus of ₹19,500 crore. The scheme is aimed at achieving manufacturing capacity of Giga Watt (GW) scale in high efficiency solar photovoltaic (PV) modules. The last date for submitting bids is January 11, 2023.

17.title: India-UAE trade to surpass $88 billion this year
17.article_body: India and UAE have projected to surpass bilateral trade worth $88 billion this year. During the five months between April and August of current fiscal year, the bilateral trade stands at $36.82 billion. UAE signed its first-ever Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement agreement with India in February this year. UAE is now India's third largest trading partner, after US & China.

18.title: I was prepared to bowl hard lengths: Siraj on posting 4/17 vs NZ in Napier
18.article_body: India pacer Mohammed Siraj, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' against New Zealand in third T20I in Napier, said the McLean Park wicket wasn't easy to bat. "I was prepared to bowl hard lengths which gave me the rewards...I just executed my plans," he added. Siraj posted bowling figures of 4-0-17-4. Match ended in a tie via DLS method.

19.title: Congress will form govt with full majority: Former Himachal party chief
19.article_body: Ahead of counting of votes in the state, former Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Sukhwinder Singh Sukhu on Monday claimed the party would form its government with a full majority. Himachal Pradesh would reject BJP's Hindutva agenda and elect a Congress government, Sukhu said. He claimed that AICC General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra mobilised the cadres in the state.

20.title: Rat faeces found in midday meal in K'taka school; headmaster demoted
20.article_body: The faeces of rats were found in rice and sambhar served in the midday meal at Government Higher Primary School in Harapanahalli taluk of Karnataka's Vijayanagara district on Monday. Following the incident, the school's headmaster was reportedly demoted to an assistant teacher, and four cooks, who failed to recognise the rat droppings while cooking, were let off with a warning.

21.title: Warm congratulations: PM Modi as Tokayev wins Kazakhstan Prez polls
21.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated Kassym-Jomart Tokayev for winning the Presidential polls in Kazakhstan. "My warm congratulations to President Tokayev," the PM tweeted, adding, "I look forward to continuing working together, to further strengthen our bilateral partnership." Tokayev won the snap elections with 81.31% of the votes and secured himself a second term of seven years.

22.title: Maha declares 1-day paid leave for voters in some border districts for Guj polls
22.article_body: Maharashtra government has declared one-day paid leave in bordering districts like Palghar, Nashik, Nandurbar and Dhule for voters enlisted in Gujarat Assembly elections. The elections will be held on December 1 and December 5. The government has also asked organisations to grant leave or a minimum of two-hour concession in working hours to the workers, employees and officers for elections.

23.title: IFS officer shares pic of homeless man sharing his mattress with stray dogs
23.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda took to Twitter to share a photo that shows a homeless man sleeping with several dogs. He can be seen sleeping on the pavement on his tiny mattress. "Our heart has to be large enough to accommodate this big world," the photo caption reads.

24.title: Move Koshyari out, appoint new Guv: Cong amid Guv's remarks on Shivaji
24.article_body: Congress leader Ashok Chavan on Tuesday said Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari should be removed from his office for his remark on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and demanded the appointment of a new governor. "The statement made by the Governor has intensified people's anger," Chavan said. Governor BS Koshyari called Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj an idol of "olden times".

25.title: Condemnable, says BJP after Raj CM calls Shraddha's murder an accident
25.article_body: BJP criticised Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot after he termed Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner as an "accident". Calling Gehlot's statement "condemnable", BJP leader Satish Poonia said, "It seems that the sentiment of Shraddha murder case has no effect on him. On the contrary, the CM is trying to justify that it was a normal incident."

26.title: Unaccounted income worth ₹100 cr detected after raids on Bihar-based businesses
26.article_body: The Income Tax Department discovered "unaccounted" income worth over ₹100 crore after conducting searches on various Bihar-based business groups dealing in real estate and diamond jewellery. Incriminating documents showing income evasion were also seized, the Department said. Unaccounted cash and jewellery worth over ₹5 crore were seized and 14 bank lockers were sealed during the operation.

27.title: 1-year-old girl gets 115 stitches on face after stray dog bites her in Ghaziabad
27.article_body: A one-year-old girl got 115 stitches during a 36-hour surgery after being attacked by a stray dog in UP's Ghaziabad. The child was attacked by the animal when she playing outside her home on Sunday, reports said. She had multiple injuries on her face, for which small stitches had to be administered, a doctor from MMG District Hospital said.

28.title: Imran Khan sold gold medal he received from India: Pakistan Defence Minister
28.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan sold a gold medal he received from India during his cricketing years, Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif claimed. Usually, such gifts are either permanently deposited in the Toshakhana or can be bought by the person who received them at a lower price. According to an earlier report, Khan admitted to selling at least four presents.

29.title: CAG initiates probe into BMC contracts worth ₹12,000 cr during pandemic
29.article_body: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) has launched a probe into contracts worth ₹12,000 crore awarded by BMC during the COVID-19 pandemic. This comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asked a probe to be conducted into projects undertaken between November 28, 2020 and February 28, 2022. The CAG team held a meeting with the municipal commissioner, a BMC official said.

30.title: Shilpa shares video with Raj Kundra on their 13th wedding anniversary
30.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram and shared a video with her husband Raj Kundra on their 13th wedding anniversary. Along with the video, Shilpa wrote, "13 years, Cookie, whoa! (and not counting). Thank you for sharing this journey with me in this lifetime and making it so beautiful...Happy Anniversary to us, Cookie." They have a son named Viaan.

31.title: Haryana's Mansa Devi temple area to be declared holy complex: CM Khattar
31.article_body: The Haryana government is planning to declare the Mata Mansa Devi temple area a 'holy complex'. "There will be a complete ban on the sale of liquor in an area of about 2.5 km around the temple," CM Manohar Lal Khattar said. He also gave updates about a Sanskrit college and old age home being built on the temple premises.

32.title: Turkey will attack militants with tanks and soldiers: Erdogan
32.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said on Tuesday that Turkey would attack militants with tanks and soldiers "as soon as possible". This comes amid an escalation in retaliatory strikes between Turkish forces and Kurdish militants along the Syrian border. Turkish warplanes struck Kurdish militant bases in Syria and Iraq over the weekend following a blast in Istanbul earlier this month.

33.title: Indians most hurt by tech layoffs in US amid green card wait as long as 195 yrs
33.article_body: Mass layoffs at technology companies in the US have hurt Indians the most, Bloomberg reported. Indians tend to be on temporary visas longer than other foreign groups because of backlogs in getting permanent residency (a green card). A congressional report estimated that Indians filing in 2020 would have to wait as long as 195 years for a green card.

34.title: The best player of the last decade: Ex-Portugal footballer Figo on Messi
34.article_body: Praising Lionel Messi, ex-Portugal footballer Luis Figo said that the Argentina captain is one of the greatest players of all time and the best player of the last decade. The 35-year-old has won the Ballon d'Or a record seven times. Meanwhile, Argentina lost their opening match of FIFA World Cup 2022 against Saudi Arabia 1-2.

35.title: Even Kasab got a fair trial, I'm surely not worse: Satyendar Jain
35.article_body: Jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday, while accusing the Enforcement Directorate (ED) of leaking footage from inside his jail cell, said, "Even [terrorist] Ajmal Kasab got a free and fair trial...I'm surely not worse." "I am defamed every single minute by their act," he added. "I have lost 28 kg in jail...What privilege are they talking about?" Jain asked.

36.title: Ajay Devgn has not approached Salman Khan for 'Bholaa' sequel: Makers
36.article_body: 'Bholaa' makers have refuted the reports stating that actor Ajay Devgn has approached actor Salman Khan for the film's sequel. "Salman and Ajay share a great rapport & friendship, however, Ajay has not approached him for the sequel of 'Bholaa'," a statement by the makers read. 'Bholaa', which will be directed by Ajay, will release on March 30, 2023.

37.title: Weather is something we cannot control: Hardik on 3rd T20I ending in a tie
37.article_body: After India-New Zealand third T20I ended in a tie via DLS method following rain interruption in Napier on Tuesday, India skipper Hardik Pandya said his side would have liked to win the match by playing the full overs. "Weather is something we cannot control," he added. The DLS par score was 75 after nine overs and India were 75/4.

38.title: It was my dream to get selected in Ind women's hockey team: Beauty
38.article_body: After being selected for the Indian women's hockey squad, 19-year-old Beauty Dungdung said that it was her dream to feature in the senior side. "Growing up, I received a lot of support from my family to pursue the sport, especially my father," she said. Beauty was part of India's squad at the junior World Cup in South Africa in 2021.

39.title: 4.5 kg of ganja seized from 2 drug peddlers arrested in Bengaluru
39.article_body: Two people were arrested from Bengaluru's Kamakshipalya for allegedly peddling marijuana and about 4.53 kg of the drug was seized from them. "A case has been registered against the accused under the NDPS Act and...the investigation is going on," said police. Earlier, Bengaluru customs officials had arrested a person at Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly travelling with narcotics.

40.title: Inform us on enforcement of pet shop rules: HC to Delhi govt
40.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has asked the government of the nation capital territory (NCT) to inform it of the "mode and manner" of implementing the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (Pet Shop) Rules, 2018. A bench of justices Amit Sharma and Siddharth Mridul made the enquiry while hearing a PIL seeking regulation of pet shops in compliance of rules.

41.title: Journalist killed, another injured while crossing road in Hyderabad
41.article_body: A 27-year-old journalist was killed and her 26-year-old colleague injured as a speeding car hit the duo while they were crossing the street in Hyderabad's Hayathnagar. "This incident is not a hit-and-run. The car has been seized, and the driver will be taken into custody," said the police. The incident took place around 5:20 in the morning on NH-65.

42.title: 354 people died in road accidents in Noida from Jan-Oct 2022: Police
42.article_body: As many as 354 people died and 680 were injured in road accidents in Gautam Buddh Nagar till October this year, according to police data. In this period, 897 road accidents were recorded in the district, which houses Noida and Greater Noida. The data was shared to observe 'World Remembrance Day', which pays tributes to victims of road mishaps.

43.title: 4 dead, another critical after consuming illicit liquor in Haryana
43.article_body: Four residents of Haryana's Sonipat district died after consuming illicit liquor, police said on Tuesday. Another person, who also consumed the liquor on Monday night, is undergoing treatment at Bhagat Phool Singh Government Medical College for Women and his condition is said to be critical. "We are in the process of registering a case," a police spokesperson said.

44.title: Akshaye was unsure about doing Drishyam 2, said 'It's Ajay's film': Director
44.article_body: Abhishek Pathak, director of Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Drishyam 2', revealed that when he offered a role to Akshaye Khanna, he was "unsure" about doing it. "He asked, 'Why me? It's Ajay sir's film...If you bring me in...something different has to be there otherwise I don't know'," Abhishek added. He further said Akshaye agreed to do the film after reading the screenplay.

45.title: Meta rolls out privacy settings to protect teens from suspicious interactions
45.article_body: Facebook and Instagram parent Meta said that teens, under the age of 16, will now be defaulted into more private settings. Meta is testing ways to protect teens from messaging suspicious adults they aren't connected with. Meta is also working to build a global platform for teens who are worried their intimate images might be shared online without their consent.

46.title: UK launches probe over Apple & Google's 'stranglehold' on mobile browsers
46.article_body: UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has launched an in-depth investigation into the market dominance of Apple and Google's mobile browsers. This comes after a study concluded the companies have the power to "exercise a stranglehold". "Many UK businesses and web developers tell us they feel...they're being held back by restrictions set by Apple and Google," a CMA official said.

47.title: Hyderabad traffic drives not for increasing govt revenue: Police
47.article_body: Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) AV Ranganath said the special traffic drives in Hyderabad are aimed at bringing about a "behavioural change in vehicle users". He further denied claims that strict implementation of rules is being conducted to shore up government revenue. The Commissioner said officials will focus on educating vehicle users from November 28 till the following weekend.

48.title: Cage set up in south Bengaluru to trap leopard that killed calf
48.article_body: The Karnataka Forest Department has put up a cage near the Turahalli forest area in south Bengaluru to catch the leopard that killed a calf on November 19. "The leopard is constantly on the move. We are also tracking its movements," said a range forest officer. The forest officials also advised nearby residents to restrict travelling during the night.

49.title: I goofed up 'Dil...' audition, director gave me 2nd chance: Rupali
49.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly shared a clip from her old TV show 'Dil Hai Ke Manta Nahin' on Instagram and revealed she "goofed up" the TV serial's audition after hearing about the role. "I...pleaded with...director...Rajan Shahi to...give me a second chance...after much pleading he gave in...[I] auditioned for about nine scenes till he was convinced to cast me," she added.

50.title: ISRO scientist loses ₹18 lakh to conman in B'luru college seat scam
50.article_body: A conman cheated a 48-year-old ISRO scientist after promising him a medical seat for his daughter at Bengaluru's BGS Global Institute of Medical Science. The accused, Arun Das, took ₹18 lakh from Chidananda Shivappa Mugdum in the name of donation. While taking the money, Das promised to approach Mugdum later for admission. However, he never returned.

51.title: Farmers' bodies ask govt to lift export ban on wheat at pre-Budget meeting
51.article_body: Farmers' organisations have asked the government to lift the ban on export of agricultural items like wheat during the pre-budget meeting with the finance ministry. They also demanded to restrict the import of products costing below the minimum support price. Bodies have asked the government to increase the domestic output of local oilseeds like soyabean and sunflower instead of palm.

52.title: Boy with rare 'werewolf syndrome' in MP has hair growing all over body, pic surfaces
52.article_body: A teenager from Madhya Pradesh lives with a rare condition called 'werewolf syndrome'. Lalit Patidar, 17, a student from Nandleta village, was diagnosed with hypertrichosis at the age of six. Hypertrichosis is characterised by an abnormal amount of hair growth all over the body. There is no cure for Lalit's condition.

53.title: What is the new format of T20 World Cup?
53.article_body: The 2024 T20 World Cup will be played in new format wherein 20 participating countries will be divided into four groups of five teams each and the first round will be followed by a Super Eight stage. The top two sides in each of the two Super Eight groups will make the semi-finals, which will be followed by the final.

54.title: Barking dog seized with fear: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's sister on US
54.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's sister, Kim Yo-jong, likened the US to "a barking dog seized with fear". She said that the US was pushing the Korean peninsula towards a new crisis and warned of "the toughest counteraction". She also accused the UNSC of "double standards" after it convened a meeting over Pyongyang's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

55.title: PhD student sets himself ablaze, hugs woman for rejecting his proposal in Maha
55.article_body: A 30-year-old PhD student died after setting himself ablaze at Government Institute of Science (GIS) in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on Monday afternoon, police said. The deceased, Gajanan Munde, followed a woman and hugged her after setting himself on fire to kill her for rejecting his marriage proposal. The woman sustained 55% burn injuries. Neither of the two people studied at GIS.

56.title: 186 kg of ganja worth ₹9 lakh seized in Tripura, 1 person arrested
56.article_body: Tripura Police, in a joint operation with Assam Rifles, busted a syndicate in which 186 kg of ganja worth approximately ₹9 lakh was seized, officials said on Tuesday. The police said they had registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act at the Sidhai police station. One person has been arrested in this connection.

57.title: One shouldn't get into acting just for money & fame: Pankaj Tripathi
57.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, sharing a piece of advice for young aspiring actors, said that one should not get into acting just for money and fame. "First understand why you want to come here (in the film industry)...understand your love, your needs," he added. "If you work with heart, money will eventually come to you at one point," Pankaj further said.

58.title: Revenue official arrested in Palghar for accepting bribe
58.article_body: A revenue official in Maharashtra's Palghar district was arrested for allegedly demanding and accepting a bribe. The government employee sought ₹30,000 from a man for updating the records of the plot purchased by the latter, an official said. The accused was posted in the district's Wada area and was caught red-handed by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau officials.

59.title: China resumes streaming S Korean content after 6-year suspension
59.article_body: A Chinese streaming platform has resumed distributing South Korean content after suspending it for nearly six years, a South Korean official said on Tuesday. Notably, earlier this month, Chinese streaming site Tencent began distributing a South Korean film. China blocked Korean content amid tensions over the installation of the US-made THAAD missile defence system in South Korea in 2017.

60.title: Cong will fight to get crop insurance compensation to farmers: Patole
60.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Tuesday said the party will launch a drive to get compensation to farmers from the insurance companies. "The farmers...are going through a big crisis...Farmers are being looted openly by insurance companies with the blessings of the Modi government," Patole said. Crop insurance help desks will be established in all districts and talukas, he added.

61.title: Can't compromise on ideological issues like Savarkar, Hindutva: Raut
61.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Uddhav Thackeray-led Sena can't compromise on key issues like respect for VD Savarkar and Hindutva. Responding to Rahul Gandhi's comment on Savarkar, which had caused a row, Raut said, "If democracy, freedom and the Constitution are to be safeguarded, then we have to forget our differences and come together."

62.title: Court seeks Tihar jail's response on Satyendar Jain's plea for food
62.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court on Tuesday sought a response from Tihar jail authorities on Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's plea for food, as per his religious beliefs. In his plea, Jain alleged that the jail authorities had stopped providing him with food items like fruits, vegetables, dry fruits and dates, which are necessary as he has been on a religious fast.

63.title: 410 kg marijuana seized from truck in Assam's Karimganj, driver escapes
63.article_body: The Assam police on Monday recovered around 410 kg of marijuana worth ₹41 lakh from a truck in Churaibari area along the Assam-Tripura border, police said. The truck's driver and cleaner allegedly managed to escape before the police intercepted the vehicle. Police are trying to find out the owner of the truck after verifying its registration number from transport authorities.

64.title: India will take up issue with Qatar: Puri on preacher Zakir Naik's World Cup lectures
64.article_body: India will take up the issue of Islamic preacher Zakir Naik being invited for lectures during the 2022 FIFA World Cup, with Qatar, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. Puri further said that the Mumbai-born fugitive evangelist is a Malaysian national. Naik founded the Islamic Research Foundation (IRF) which has been banned in India since 2016.

65.title: AAP plans magic shows, 1,000 'nukkad sabhas' for MCD polls
65.article_body: AAP has planned magic shows, street plays and 1,000 street-corner meetings with star campaigners for the second phase of MCD polls scheduled to take place on December 4. The theme of the second phase of the campaign is 'Kejriwal ki Sarkar, Kejriwal ka Paarshad'. AAP leader Gopal Rai said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal brought unprecedented development to the city.

66.title: B'luru sees highest growth in office rentals across Asia-Pacific: Report
66.article_body: As per Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index, Bengaluru posted the highest office rental growth in the Asia-Pacific region in the July-September quarter. Office rent in Bengaluru rose 12.1% year-on-year in the quarter. Jakarta was ranked second, followed by Mumbai. As per the data, rental growth in Bengaluru, Mumbai and Delhi-NCR remained flat compared with the April-June quarter.

67.title: Vedanta approves third interim dividend of ₹17.50 per share
67.article_body: Vedanta on Tuesday announced its third interim dividend of the current fiscal year of ₹17.50 per equity share. The dividend will lead to a total payout of ₹6,505 crore to shareholders. The company's board approved the interim dividend, which translates to 1750% of the face value of every share worth ₹1, according to an exchange filing.

68.title: Pune Police officials suspended, transferred for negligence in murder case
68.article_body: The Pune Police has suspended a sub-inspector and transferred two policemen pending an inquiry into alleged negligence in responding to harassment complaints by a woman who was recently murdered by her harasser. The accused officials have been identified as Vaishali Sool, Shamal Powar and Rajkumar Waghchaware, police said. The deceased was allegedly killed by the suspect, Pratik, on Wednesday.

69.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia misleading people: Alka Lamba on Jain's Tihar video
69.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia of misleading people after a video went viral of AAP leader Satyendar Jain getting massage in Tihar jail. "[Both said] that he is seriously unwell and was receiving physiotherapy…But later...Jail officials...revealed that he was not [a] physiotherapist but an inmate arrested for raping children," said Lamba.

70.title: 'It's the reflex': Veteran who helped disarm gunman at US gay club
70.article_body: An Army veteran who is one of two men being lauded for subduing the gunman during Saturday's mass shooting at an LGBTQ club in Colorado has attributed the apparently heroic act to his military instincts. "It's the reflex: Go! Go to the fire...Stop the activity. Don't let no one (sic) get hurt," US Army veteran Rich Fierro said on Monday.

71.title: UK-India FTA a high priority, negotiations to begin next month: Piyush Goyal
71.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the negotiations for the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and UK are slated to happen next month. "With UK, we are doing a comprehensive deal like the UAE...I assure you that it's a high priority of both countries," Goyal added. The trade between the two countries increased to $17.5 billion in 2021-22.

72.title: What is a leap second and why is it being scrapped?
72.article_body: A leap second is a one-second adjustment occasionally applied to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) either on June 30 or on December 31 to adjust the difference between exact atomic time and Earth's slower rotation. Technology companies, which have to synchronise their systems worldwide to add leap second, protest the practice. Now, governments have decided to scrap leap seconds by 2035.

73.title: I watch 2-3 scenes of Sholay when I face creative block: RRR writer
73.article_body: 'RRR' writer Vijayendra Prasad called himself a fan of Salim Khan and Javed Akhtar. He said that he watches two-three scenes from their film 'Sholay' whenever he faces "a creative block". The writer also spoke about how 1957 film 'Mayabazar' influenced his filmography. "In that film...Not even a single shot is wasted," he added.

74.title: North Goa beaches to have no-take zones to protect environment: Govt
74.article_body: Goa Minister Vishwajit Rane on Tuesday announced 'no-take zones' will be set up at Morjim, Ashvem and Arambol beaches to protect and preserve the environment. "Activities are taking place without permission and destruction of sand dunes is taking place," he tweeted. A no-take zone is an area where extractive activities like fishing, hunting, logging, mining and drilling aren't allowed.

75.title: Messi-led Argentina lose 1-2 against 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in 2022 FIFA WC
75.article_body: Lionel Messi-led Argentina lost 1-2 against 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Tuesday. Messi opened the scoring for Argentina in the 10th minute through a penalty. Forward Saleh Al-Shehri equalised for Saudi Arabia in the 48th minute, with mid-fielder Salem Al Dawsari scoring the winner five minutes later.

76.title: WHO to identify pathogens that could cause future pandemics, 'Disease X' on list
76.article_body: WHO is launching a global scientific process to update the list of priority pathogens. WHO is convening over 300 scientists who will consider evidence on over 25 virus families and bacteria, as well as 'Disease X'. 'Disease X' is included to indicate an unknown pathogen that could cause serious international epidemic. The current list includes COVID-19 and SARS, among others.

77.title: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan gets bail in 2019 hate speech case
77.article_body: A sessions court in UP's Rampur on Tuesday granted bail to Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in a 2019 hate speech case, which had led to his disqualification from the UP Assembly. Khan, along with two others, was sentenced to three years in jail, following his comments on UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

78.title: TN reporting over 4,500 conjunctivitis cases daily, state govt issues warning
78.article_body: Cases of conjunctivitis, also known as 'Madras Eye', have been rising in Tamil Nadu, with the state reporting over 4,500 cases daily. State Health Minister Ma Subramanian has urged people to avoid self-medication and not use medicines prescribed to other family members. "The medication...is subjective from person to person. If...wrong medicine is used, it...may cause loss of vision," he said.

79.title: Actor Ranjeet's son Jeeva to make his B'wood debut with 'Govinda...'
79.article_body: Veteran actor Ranjeet's son Jeeva is making his Bollywood debut with Vicky Kaushal's upcoming film 'Govinda Naam Mera'. Sharing his look from the film, Ranjeet wished luck to his son and the film's team. Talking about his debut, Jeeva said, "It feels surreal...This journey gave me the rare opportunity to absorb invaluable experience from the best of our industry."

80.title: 'Kantara' becomes second Kannada film to cross ₹400 cr worldwide
80.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has become the second Kannada film to cross ₹400 crore mark worldwide. The film has collected ₹400.90 crore worldwide. Over the weekend, it also became the highest-grossing film in Karnataka by overtaking the mark set by Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2'. In North India, 'Kantara' is inching closer to ₹100 crore mark.

81.title: Western Railways' longest skywalk to connect Bandra Suburban Station & Terminus
81.article_body: The Western Railways is all set to construct a new 340-metre-long skywalk that will connect the Bandra Suburban Station and Bandra Terminus in Mumbai. This skywalk will surpass the 314-metre-long skywalk between the Khar Railway Station and Bandra Terminus to become the longest skywalk of the Western Railways. The estimated cost of the project is around ₹32.3 crore.

82.title: Centre may provide ₹1.6 lakh cr additional funds for rural schemes
82.article_body: The Centre is likely to increase its allocation to the Ministry of Rural Development by 18% to ₹1.6 lakh crore to bolster the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MNREGA), Reuters reported citing a government source. Of the budgeted ₹73,000 crore for MNREGA, the Centre has already spent ₹63,260 crore. The rural unemployment rate in October was reportedly 8.04%.

83.title: Jio gains 7.24 lakh users in Sept, Airtel adds 4.12 lakh users: TRAI
83.article_body: Reliance Jio added 7.24 lakh mobile subscribers in September, according to data released by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). India's total mobile subscriber base fell by 36 lakh in September, with Vodafone Idea (VI) facing a decline of 40 lakh in September. Bharti Airtel added 4.12 lakh subscribers in September, the data showed.

84.title: Credit Suisse lays off a third of its China-based investment bankers: Report
84.article_body: Credit Suisse has laid off nearly one-third of its China-based investment banking team and almost half of its research department, Reuters reported citing sources. The report added that over 20 China-based investment bankers were notified about job cuts and 10 employees in the research department were fired. Last month, Credit Suisse announced a capital raise of 4 billion Swiss francs.

85.title: Kim's daughter, seen in public for 1st time, is his second child: Spy agency
85.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's daughter, who was seen in public for the first time recently during a visit to a missile site, is his second child, a South Korean spy agency said. The girl is named Ju Ae and is aged around 10, it told South Korean lawmakers. Kim's wife Ri Sol Ju also observed the missile launch.

86.title: Zerodha fixes glitches after users complain of losses while trading
86.article_body: Zerodha users on Tuesday complained that they were facing issues during the morning trading and were unable to login to their accounts and check, or modify their orders. While Zerodha apologised for the inconvenience and said the glitches were resolved, some users said that orders were still not getting executed. "Trade execution was unaffected," said a company official.

87.title: Europe to be hit hardest by global slowdown: OECD
87.article_body: The global economy should avoid a recession next year but the worst-energy crisis since the 1970s will trigger a sharp slowdown and Europe will be hit the hardest, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) said. The global economic growth is set to slow from 3.1% this year to 2.2% next year before accelerating to 2.7% in 2024, it said.

88.title: Kartik seeks blessings at Siddhivinayak Temple on his b'day, pics surface
88.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, who turned 32 on Tuesday, visited Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai to seek blessings on his birthday, along with his parents. In videos and pictures that have surfaced, he can be seen posing for the photographers outside the temple and clicking pictures with some fans. On the work front, Kartik will next be seen in 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

89.title: BJP uses 'giant mosquito' to protest against rising dengue cases in WB
89.article_body: West Bengal BJP leaders took to the streets of Kolkata to protest against the rising number of dengue cases in the state. In a video, the BJP leaders can be seen protesting against the government using a mosquito net and a giant model of a mosquito. "Health Minister doesn't come to the House (Assembly)," said BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari.

90.title: Telangana Congress leader M Shashidhar Reddy quits the party
90.article_body: Senior Telangana Congress leader and former minister M Shashidhar Reddy on Tuesday announced his resignation from the party. His resignation comes days after the Congress expelled him for six years following his meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Addressing a press conference, Reddy claimed the Congress has not been able to effectively take on TRS in the state.

91.title: Mental health festival 'UDAAN' to be held in Hyderabad on Nov 27
91.article_body: An NGO is set to hold a mental health festival named UDAAN at the Exhibition Grounds in Hyderabad's Nampally on November 27. The festival seeks to tackle mental health-related taboos and focus on how to overcome struggles with the help of art, media and dialogues. It'll comprise of nine events, including 'Circle of Relatability', 'Glee Praxis' and 'Taare Zameen Par'.

92.title: Akshay to join Taapsee, Vaani & Ammy in comedy film Khel Khel Mein: Reports
92.article_body: Akshay Kumar has signed on to star in a comedy film titled 'Khel Khel Mein', as per reports. The upcoming film will also feature Vaani Kapoor, Taapsee Pannu and Ammy Virk in prominent roles, reports added. It will reportedly be directed by filmmaker Mudassar Aziz, who has previously helmed films like 'Happy Bhaag Jayegi' and 'Pati Patni Aur Woh'.

93.title: Hyderabad Police issue traffic advisory for phase 2 of SNDP works
93.article_body: Hyderabad Police issued traffic restrictions ahead of the commencement of the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) phase two works for 3 months. The traffic restrictions will be in place for the construction of the nullah between Rasoolpura to Ramgopalpet police station on Minister Road in Begumpet. Patients going to KIMS Hospital, Minister Road will have to take U-turn at CTO.

94.title: Air India most-punctual airline in Oct with 90.8% punctuality: DGCA
94.article_body: Air India was the most-punctual airline in October with a 90.8% punctuality, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) data showed. The On-Time Performance (OTP) of scheduled domestic airlines is recorded at four metro airports—Bengaluru, Delhi, Hyderabad and Mumbai. The second and third-best punctual airlines were Vistara and AirAsia. These were followed by IndiGo.

95.title: Video shows Japanese World Cup fans cleaning Qatar stadium after match, praised
95.article_body: A video has shown Japanese World Cup tourists cleaning a stadium in Qatar after the opening match between Ecuador and the host country on Sunday. The video was posted on Instagram by Bahraini content creator Omar Farooq, after which it went viral. The Japanese spectators were praised by online users for their cleaning efforts which included collecting littered flags.

96.title: Drug trafficking from across border major concern for Northeast: CM Saha
96.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Tuesday said drug trafficking from across the border is a major concern for the northeast region. He inaugurated the two-day meeting of DGPs and heads of Central Police Organisations (CPOs) of the northeast region. "The two-day meeting…will throw light on the problem and find ways for tackling it effectively," CM Saha stated.

97.title: BJP says actors paid to walk with Rahul Gandhi, Congress rejects claim
97.article_body: The BJP has alleged that the Congress party is paying actors to walk with MP Rahul Gandhi in the Bharat Jodo Yatra and shared an anonymous WhatsApp message to support its claim. Meanwhile, the Congress replied to the unnamed message and said that this shows how desperately the BJP is trying to discredit the yatra.

98.title: It's like national team facing village team: Aakash on TN scoring 506
98.article_body: Talking about Tamil Nadu becoming the first-ever team to breach the 500-run mark in a List A (50-over) match after scoring 506 in a Vijay Hazare Trophy clash against Arunachal Pradesh, commentator Aakash Chopra tweeted, "How's this correct?" "It's like a national team playing against a village team...What purpose does it serve to have this sort [of]...contest?" added Aakash.

99.title: Meta sued in UK over collecting, processing personal data for ads
99.article_body: Human rights campaigner, Tanya O'Carroll, has sued Meta in the UK for "surveillance advertising", the law firm representing her said. O'Carroll alleged that Meta breached UK data laws by not respecting her right to demand Facebook to stop processing her data for advertisements. "This case is...about us all being able to connect with social media on our...terms," said O'Carroll.

100.title: Death toll from Indonesia's earthquake rises to 268; 151 still missing
100.article_body: The death toll from a 5.6-magnitude earthquake that hit Indonesia's West Java province on Monday has risen to 268 as more bodies were found beneath collapsed buildings, the national disaster mitigation agency said. Around 151 people are still missing, it added. Authorities reported that over 300 people were seriously wounded and at least 600 more have suffered minor injuries.

101.title: Delhi excise dept raids birthday party, seizes 65 alcohol bottles
101.article_body: Delhi's excise department arrested a man from Delhi following a raid at a birthday party, where alcohol was being served without a liquor license, officials said on Monday. The Excise Intelligence Bureau (EIB) has also seized over 65 bottles of high-end liquor. The seized liquor bottles included 19 bottles of Chivas Regal and four bottles of Grey Goose Vodka.

102.title: German priest abducted by suspected Islamists in Mali's capital
102.article_body: A German priest was abducted by suspected Islamic extremists in Mali's capital, Bamako, on Sunday. Reverend Hans-Joachim Lohre was preparing to go celebrate Mass in another part of the city when he was kidnapped, Dia Monique Pare, Lohre's colleague, said. The alleged abduction is said to be the first kidnapping of a Westerner in Bamako in more than a decade.

103.title: King Charles to host his 1st state visit for South African President
103.article_body: King Charles will host his first state visit, since his accession to the throne, for South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Tuesday. The late Queen Elizabeth II hosted the last state visit in 2019 for former US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania Trump. Ramaphosa will be officially greeted by Prince and Princess of Wales, William and wife Kate.

104.title: It will be special that Maradona will not be present for WC: Messi
104.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi said late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona not being present for the 2022 FIFA World Cup will make it "special". "It [feels] strange...to [not] see him in the stands," added Messi. This will be the first edition of the FIFA World Cup where Maradona will not be present in the stands to support Argentina.

105.title: Rozgar Mela recruits are my co-travellers in country's development: PM Modi
105.article_body: PM Narendra Modi hailed new recruits hired during the Rozgar Mela as his "colleagues and co-travellers" in the country's development. PM Modi on Tuesday distributed 71,056 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela. Launching an online orientation course for them, Karmayogi Prarambh module, PM Modi urged them to give him feedback after a month, like "colleagues and co-travellers".

106.title: US VP Harris visits Philippine island as part of her 3-day trip
106.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris visited the Philippine island of Palawan in the South China Sea during her three-day trip. On Monday, Harris pledged that the US would defend the Philippines if it came under attack. Beijing claims almost all of South China Sea as its own territory. Harris is the highest-ranking official from the Biden administration to visit Philippines.

107.title: Nykaa CFO Arvind Agarwal resigns
107.article_body: Nykaa's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Arvind Agarwal is resigning from his position effective November 25. Agarwal is leaving to pursue other opportunities in the digital economy and startup space, the company said. Meanwhile, Nykaa Founder and CEO Falguni Nayar praised the executive for his "critical role" and said, "While we do regret losing him, we...wish him all the luck."

108.title: CBI files 500-page chargesheet in Goa court in Sonali Phogat murder case
108.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation has filed a chargesheet of around 500 pages against Sudhir Sangwan and Sukhwinder Singh, in connection with the murder of Sonali Phogat, before a court in Goa. Reports said that CBI accused Phogat's personal assistant of murder and of forcing her to take drugs. Phogat was declared dead in North Goa on August 23.

109.title: China set to impose fine of over $1 bn on Jack Ma's Ant Group: Reports
109.article_body: Chinese authorities may reportedly impose a fine of over $1 billion on Jack Ma's Ant Group. The People's Bank of China is readying the fine. Ant Group's $37-billion IPO was suspended at the last minute in 2020. The fine on Ant would be the largest regulatory penalty imposed on a Chinese internet company since the $1.2-billion fine on Didi Global.

110.title: UP court gives life imprisonment to man who killed woman for property
110.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh sentenced a man to life imprisonment for killing a woman for property. The man first conspired with the woman, his friend's wife, to kill him, as per the prosecution. When the woman refused to hand over her dead husband's property to him, he murdered her too by stabbing her in the neck.

111.title: Situation in Iran critical: UN rights chief amid anti-hijab protests
111.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk said the situation in Iran was "critical" as over 300 people have died in the past two months amid anti-hijab protests. Iran has been gripped by nationwide protests since the death of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini in morality police custody on September 16 after being arrested for wearing clothes deemed "inappropriate".

112.title: 3,165 tickets were issued on day bridge collapsed in Morbi: Probe report
112.article_body: A forensic probe report into the bridge collapse in Morbi has claimed 3,165 tickets were issued on October 30, the day of the incident. "According to the FSL report, the cables of the bridge were rusty, anchors were broken and bolts that connect cables with anchors were loose," a government lawyer said. He claimed Oreva Group didn't take any precautions.

113.title: Lionel Messi becomes 1st Argentinian to score at 4 different FIFA World Cups
113.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi on Tuesday became the first-ever Argentinian footballer to score at four different World Cups. Messi achieved the feat after opening the scoring for Argentina in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Saudi Arabia today. Prior to 2022 FIFA World Cup, Messi had scored in the 2006, 2014 and 2018 editions.

114.title: NHAI begins anti-encroachment drive near Pune's Navale bridge
114.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has launched an anti-encroachment drive on the sides of the highway and service roads near Pune's Navale bridge area. The step comes after an accident occurred on the Katraj-Dehu Road Bypass on Sunday in which around 48 vehicles got damaged and at least six people sustained injuries and had to be hospitalised.

115.title: Dr Reddy's faces antitrust lawsuit in US over cancer drug Revlimid
115.article_body: Hyderabad-based Dr Reddy's Laboratories, along with US-based Celgene and Bristol Myers Squibb, is facing an antitrust lawsuit in US over a cancer drug. The complaint, filed on November 18 in New Jersey, alleges the companies improperly restrained competition concerning generic Revlimid and maintained a shared monopoly. The complaint seeks damages for purported overpayments and equitable relief.

116.title: 6 die in Assam-Meghalaya border firing, internet shut in 7 Meghalaya districts
116.article_body: Six persons, including an Assam forest official, died in firing at the Assam-Meghalaya border after the Assam forest department intercepted a truck allegedly transporting illegal timber. Meghalaya has suspended internet services in seven districts, namely West Jaintia Hills, East Jaintia Hills, East Khasi Hills, Ri-Bhoi, Eastern West Khasi Hills, West Khasi Hills and South West Khasi Hills.

117.title: Bill Gates shares list of his 5 all-time favourite books
117.article_body: Bill Gates shared a list of his five all-time favourite books in his annual holiday reading recommendations. Gates said this year, he didn't just choose books he read in the previous year. The list includes his favourite sci-fi book since his childhood, 'Stranger in a Strange Land' by Robert Heinlein, and a brand new memoir by U2's Bono called 'Surrender'.

118.title: NPAs increased by 365%, ₹10 lakh crore written off in last 5 years: Shrinate
118.article_body: The Congress criticised the Centre over the 365% rise in non-performing assets (NPAs) and asked the government about its plan to bring back wilful defaulters. Congress leader Supriya Shrinate claimed that in the last five years, the government has written off ₹10 lakh crore and only 13 percent of that amount has been recovered.

119.title: MMRDA to prepare a Climate Action Plan to tackle climate change
119.article_body: A Climate Action Plan is being prepared by Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) to help authorities tackle potential challenges posed by the likelihood of floods and rising temperature. "Climate change possesses a significant risk threatening the present and future," an official said. The Climate Action Plan will be implemented along with United Nations Environment Programme.

120.title: Brazil, Argentina football fans clash in Kerala's Kollam
120.article_body: A clash broke out between fans of Brazilian and Argentinian football teams during a roadshow in Kerala's Kollam district. The roadshow was held during the FIFA World Cup inauguration in Qatar. A video surfaced showing the fans punching, kicking and wrestling with each other, while some used sticks to strike. The police have lodged an FIR.

121.title: Domestic air passenger traffic in Oct increases over 27% YoY to 1.14 cr
121.article_body: Domestic air passenger traffic increased 27% year-on-year to 1.14 crore passengers in October, data released by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation showed (DGCA). During the January-October 2022 period, domestic airlines carried 9.88 crore passengers, up 59% from 6.20 crore during the year-ago period. As per the data, domestic leader IndiGo's market share dipped to a five-month low of 56.7%.

122.title: Absence of Mane is problem for us: Senegal manager after loss to Netherlands
122.article_body: After Senegal's 0-2 loss against Netherlands in their first Group A match at FIFA World Cup 2022, Senegal manager Aliou Cisse said his side is disappointed to have not scored, adding they had two or three very good chances. "Ismaila Sarr and Krepin Diatta are responsible there, but of course...absence of Sadio Mane is a problem for us," he stated.

123.title: BBMP suspends 3 revenue officials over B'luru voter data theft case
123.article_body: Civic body BBMP on Monday suspended three revenue officials, who were also electoral officers of Assembly constituencies, for their alleged involvement in the Bengaluru voter data theft case. The accused allegedly issued block-level government ID cards to the NGO which collected personal data of voters by using the cards. Krishnappa Ravikumar, the Co-founder of the NGO, was earlier arrested.

124.title: Mumbai Traffic Police receives hoax call about Dawood planning to kill PM Modi
124.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police on Monday received a call and message about gangster Dawood Ibrahim planning to kill Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The caller told the police that two henchmen of Dawood have come to India to kill Modi and that Kerala Police were also summoned to foil his efforts. Police traced the caller and found that he was mentally unstable.

125.title: Not going to be mother in this life, want to have orphanage: Neha Bhasin
125.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin said she's not going to be a mother in this life. "I want to have an orphanage, where I nurture at least 10 to 12 children, give them education, love...the life they deserve," she added. Neha stated she never had a "maternal instinct" of having her own children, however, was clear about adopting a child since childhood.

126.title: Parts of Pune to face water cut on Thursday
126.article_body: All the Peth areas, Quarter Gate, Lohianagar, Sahakarnagar, Padmavati, Bibwewadi, Maharshinagar, Gangadham, Katraj and Shivajinagar among others in Pune will face water cut on Thursday for repairs at Parvati substation. The areas that get supply from the SNDT water tank, like Bhandarkar Road, Law College Road, Karve Road, Yerawada, Chandangar and some parts of Sinhgad, will also face water cuts.

127.title: Wonder what kind of player he wants to be: Harsha on Pant's 11(5) vs NZ
127.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to discuss Rishabh Pant's 11 off five deliveries in India's third T20I against New Zealand, stating he "wonders" about the kind of player Pant wants to be in T20s. "If he wants to slog at the top, he will sell his rare skills short," said Bhogle in his tweet. Pant's knock comprised two fours.

128.title: Pregnant women to get free ultrasound, breakfast at UP health centres
128.article_body: Pregnant women will get free ultrasound facility and breakfast when they go for checkups at community health centres (CHCs) in Uttar Pradesh, said Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak. The facilities will be provided under the Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA). "Ultrasound facility will start under public-private-partnership mode at health centres lacking [the] facility," added Pathak.

129.title: Mumbai Police arrest 2 from Jharkhand for cheating people in electricity bill fraud
129.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two persons from Jharkhand for allegedly cheating residents of Mumbai on the pretext of paying electricity bills. "We had a team in Jharkhand and looking at the modus operandi, we believed that some cheats from that state only...[were involved]," an investigating official said. Six mobile handsets and 10 SIM cards were reportedly seized during the search.

130.title: Iran enriching uranium to 60% purity at underground nuclear site
130.article_body: Iran has started enriching uranium to 60% purity at the country's underground Fordow nuclear plant, state media reported on Tuesday. The move is in response to the UN nuclear watchdog's demand for more cooperation from Tehran, state media said. As per the 2015 nuclear deal between Iran and the world powers, Iran is prohibited from enriching uranium above 3.67% purity.

131.title: UCO Bank stock up by 14% to touch 52-week high of ₹21.35 apiece
131.article_body: UCO Bank's stock surged by over 14% to hit a new 52-week high of ₹21.35/piece on Tuesday amid reports of shares changing hands. Around 1.18 crore shares or 0.1% reportedly changed hands in nine transactions on the NSE. Meanwhile, the central government has named Rajendra Kumar Saboo as the Executive Director of the bank for a period of three years.

132.title: Former Apple Daily journalists plead guilty to foreign collusion
132.article_body: A group of senior journalists who worked at a pro-democracy tabloid in Hong Kong, Apple Daily, have pleaded guilty to foreign collusion. Six journalists have admitted to conspiring with Apple Daily's founder Jimmy Lai to call for sanctions and blockades against China and Hong Kong. The former staffers face life imprisonment, the highest punishment under China's 2020 National Security Law.

133.title: 40 foreign nationals arrested during anti-govt protests: Iran
133.article_body: Iran has arrested 40 foreign nationals for their alleged involvement in the ongoing anti-government protests in the country, Iran's judiciary spokesman Masoud Setayeshi said on Tuesday. In September, Tehran said nine Europeans had been arrested in connection with the protests. Iran maintains that "foreign adversaries" are behind the protests, which were sparked by Mahsa Amini's custodial death.

134.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma rent a flat in Mumbai's Juhu for ₹2.76 lakh per month
134.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, have rented a flat for ₹2.76 lakh per month in Mumbai's Juhu. The apartment is owned by cricket administrator and former cricketer Samarjitsinh Gaekwad, who is also a descendant of the royal family of Baroda. The flat is spread over 1,650 sq ft.

135.title: Google parent Alphabet plans to fire 10,000 'low-performing' employees: Report
135.article_body: Google's parent company Alphabet is planning to fire about 10,000 "low-performing" employees or 6% of its workforce, as per a report. Google managers have been asked to identify and rank 6% staff as 'poor performing', in contrast to 2% in the previous performance review system. The new system also reduces the percentage of employees that can score a high rating.

136.title: Australian Parliament approves Free Trade Agreement with India
136.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announced that the Australian Parliament has ratified the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with India. The announcement comes days after Albanese said that he will visit India in March 2023. Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal had earlier said FTA would take bilateral trade from $27.5 billion to $45-50 billion in the next five years.

137.title: Can't control people's reactions: 'Laal...' maker on film facing criticism
137.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan, reacting to the criticism that his film faced, said that he can't control people's reactions. He added that he only worries about things that he can control. "People, who are spending so much money to watch our films, have all the right to criticise," Advait further said.

138.title: AWS launches India's second infrastructure region in Hyderabad
138.article_body: Amazon Web Services (AWS) announced that it has launched the AWS Asia Pacific (Hyderabad) region, its second AWS infrastructure region in India, joining its first region in Mumbai. The company has also announced a planned investment of $4.4 billion (approximately ₹36,300 crore) in the India market by 2030. The investment is estimated to create over 48,000 full-time jobs annually.

139.title: India win 10th international series in a row as 3rd T20I against NZ ends in a tie
139.article_body: The third India-New Zealand T20I ended in a tie (DLS method) in Napier. India dismissed New Zealand for 160 in 19.4 overs and scored 75/4 in nine overs before rain occurred. The match ended in a tie as DLS par score for India after nine overs was 75. India clinched the series 1-0, their tenth consecutive series victory across formats.

140.title: Mohanlal is great but Hindi audience relates Drishyam more with Ajay: Maker
140.article_body: Director Abhishek Pathak spoke about his film 'Drishyam 2', which is a remake of Mohanlal-starrer Malayalam film of the same name. "Mohanlal sir is a great actor...but...Hindi audiences relate Drishyam somewhere more with...Ajay Devgn," he said. Abhishek added that even though the Malayalam film was released first, many people didn't watch it as they wanted to see the Hindi version.

141.title: Filmmaker in me has grown: Sidharth Malhotra on 10 yrs in Bollywood
141.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who completed 10 years in the film industry in October, said the filmmaker in him has grown and the actor in him has learned "so much". "I finally have a voice. I can voice my personality or my viewpoints now much better in the filmmaking language," he added. Sidharth made his debut with 'Student Of The Year'.

142.title: Indian think tank reiterated they'll never change by picking Shreyas: Ganesh
142.article_body: Discussing India's lineup for their third T20I against New Zealand, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh tweeted, "By picking Shreyas Iyer ahead of Sanju Samson, the Indian think tank has reiterated that they'll not learn from their mistakes." "[They've also reiterated that they'll] never change their approach towards T20s," added Ganesh. Shreyas was dismissed for a golden duck in the third T20I.

143.title: Al-Shabab gunman kills 3 Kenyan peacekeepers in southern Somalia
143.article_body: A lone gunman entered a military base in southern Somalia's Lower Jubba region and killed 3 Kenyan peacekeepers on Monday, according to Kenya's military. Five other soldiers were injured in the indiscriminate firing by the gunman, a Kenyan military official said under anonymity. The attacker was subsequently gunned down. Militant group al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

144.title: Raveena Tandon shares video claiming 'stones thrown' at tiger in Bhopal park, probe begins
144.article_body: Authorities at Bhopal's Van Vihar National Park are probing an incident after Raveena Tandon shared a video claiming some miscreants threw stones at a tiger in enclosure. The authorities said action will be taken against them. The park's director said that the video did not show anyone throwing stones, but someone is heard shouting from behind, "Who threw the stone?"

145.title: BJP leader calls for FIFA WC boycott over invite to Indian fugitive
145.article_body: BJP leader Savio Rodrigues on Tuesday appealed to the government and those travelling to Qatar for the FIFA World Cup, to boycott the event over an invitation to Indian fugitive Zakir Naik. Rodrigues said that inviting Naik when the world was battling terrorism was akin to giving a terrorist a platform to spread hate.

146.title: Chief Secy directs officials to decongest 10 key areas in Bengaluru
146.article_body: Karnataka Chief Secretary Vandita Sharma directed the authorities to decongest bottlenecks from 10 major traffic junctions in Bengaluru during a coordination meeting held on Monday. Silk Board, Iblur, Jayadeva, MM Temple Junction at Tin Factory, Hebbal, Goraguntepalya, Sarakki, KS Layout, Kadubeesanahalli and Banashankari have been identified as the major bottlenecks by Bengaluru Traffic Police.

147.title: Broadcom's $61 billion deal to buy VMware faces probe in UK
147.article_body: Britain's Competition and Markets Authority is looking into opening a formal investigation into US chipmaker Broadcom's proposed $61 billion deal to buy cloud computing company VMware. The regulator aims to determine whether the deal would substantially lessen competition. The acquisition, announced in May, is the second largest globally so far this year and is being probed by US authorities too.

148.title: upGrad appoints Anuj Vishwakarma to lead online higher education
148.article_body: Higher edtech unicorn upGrad appointed Anuj Vishwakarma as the President of its online higher education programs. The company stated that Vishwakarma will be responsible for building the online higher-ed vertical and scaling the business in his new role. Before upGrad, the company said, he has driven growth for consumer internet players like Myntra, Paytm and Ola.

149.title: 2 policemen assaulted over loud music at DJ party in Gurugram
149.article_body: Three men allegedly assaulted two policemen who had gone to check a complaint of loud music at a DJ party in Gurugram, police said. Constable Bhupender alleged that the accused banged his head on the wall and also tore his uniform. He added that the accused also beat up Special Police Officer Ranbir when he intervened.

150.title: Putin to meet mothers of Russian soldiers amid Ukraine war: Report
150.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet the mothers of Russian soldiers in the coming days amid the ongoing war in Ukraine, the Vedomosti newspaper reported, citing multiple sources. Russia celebrates Mother's Day on November 27. According to Ukraine's Defence Ministry, Ukrainian forces have killed more than 85,000 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24.

151.title: Bruce Lee died at 32 from drinking too much water, claims study
151.article_body: Martial artist and actor Bruce Lee, who passed away at 32 in Hong Kong in July 1973, may have died from drinking too much water, a study suggested. An autopsy showed that he died from cerebral oedema, or brain swelling. Researchers suggest hyponatraemia caused oedema, while adding, "the kidney's inability to excrete excess water killed Bruce Lee."

152.title: 2 Indians take 4-wicket hauls in the same T20I for the first time in history
152.article_body: The third T20I between India and New Zealand on Tuesday marked the first instance of two Indian bowlers taking four-wicket hauls in the same T20I match. Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh registered bowling figures of 4-0-37-4 in the match, while Mohammed Siraj recorded figures of 4-0-17-4 as India bowled New Zealand out for 160 in 19.4 overs.

153.title: Smith waits to go off after getting caught behind as umpire waits for appeal, video viral
153.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith waited to go off after getting caught behind as the umpire delayed his decision in their third ODI match against England on Tuesday. The video of the incident, which has gone viral, shows Smith gloving the ball and waiting, after which Jos Buttler appealed. Umpire Paul Wilson then raised his finger to send Smith back.

154.title: Technology is taking away a lot of jobs: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath
154.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has said that "technology is taking away a lot of jobs". In an interview with BQ Prime, the billionaire stated, "Technology is just making things more and more efficient and medical progress is increasing the lifespan." He further said that it "might become very hard" for today's 20-year-olds to find a new job when they're 50.

155.title: You'll make India proud: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar to Ola's Bhavish
155.article_body: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma met Ola Co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal at the ride-hailing platform's headquarters and said that the team will make the country proud. Taking to Twitter, Sharma said, "Inspiring is an understatement for what I saw today at Ola." Replying to Sharma, Aggarwal said, "Wonderful to see you Vijay, and thanks for the inspiration!"

156.title: 10-year-old girl dragged to forest, killed by leopard in UP
156.article_body: A 10-year-old girl was dragged to a forest and killed by a leopard while she was plucking vegetables from a field in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich on Monday. After the locals raised an alarm and surrounded the animal, it left the girl and went into the forest. The victim succumbed to her injuries.

157.title: Hyderabad to get India's biggest projection screen at Prasads Multiplex
157.article_body: Hyderabad's Prasads Multiplex is upgrading its theatre and setting up the biggest projection screen in India, Assistant Manager (IT & Technical) of Prasads Cinemas Mohan Kumar said. The screen measures about 64 feet high and 101.6 feet wide. "[This screen is] tallest that can be made in the whole world," Kumar added. This projection facility will open from December 16.

158.title: 'Rozgar Melas' in NDA-ruled states benefit of double engine govts: PM
158.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi distributed over 71,000 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela on Tuesday, he said similar campaigns have been held in NDA-ruled states and UTs in the past one month. "This is double benefit of double-engine governments. The campaign to hand over appointment letters to youth shall continue in a sustained manner," PM Modi added.

159.title: Man arrested for molesting, assaulting girl in her home in Mumbai
159.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly molesting and assaulting a 13-year-old girl at the latter's residence in the Chunabhatti area of Mumbai. The incident happened when the minor's parents were not present at their house, police said. Notably, the accused and victim live in the same locality. The complaint was filed after victim narrated the incident to her parents.

160.title: Fraudster cites medical emergency, cheats Maharashtra man of ₹18.5 lakh
160.article_body: A 52-year-old Nagpur resident was cheated of ₹18.5 lakh by a man who claimed to know his close friend, police said. The fraudster called the victim and said he was a close friend of victim's friend and that his mother was admitted to a hospital in Nagpur. He then requested the victim to make payments online urgently for medical expenses.

161.title: HDFC, IOC, others to issue bonds tomorrow to raise ₹9,200 cr: Report
161.article_body: About six companies including HDFC, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) and Rural Electrification Corporation (REC) are reportedly planning to raise ₹9,200 crore through corporate bonds on Wednesday. REC is aiming ₹4,000 crore, which includes ₹3,500 crore in greenshoe through bonds maturing in 180 months, while IOC is aiming ₹2,500 crore, including ₹1,500 crore in greenshoe through five-year bonds.

162.title: BluSmart plans to raise $250 mn to expand to 6 cities by 2024
162.article_body: Gurugram-based electric ride-hailing platform BluSmart plans to raise $250 million to expand its presence to six cities with a fleet of 25,000 cars by the end of 2024. The startup has raised $75 million so far from venture capitalists like BP Ventures, Mayfield and 9Unicorns. BluSmart claims its premium segment pricing is 15% cheaper than the competition on an average.

163.title: Anganwadi workers go on indefinite dharna, 60,000 centres shut in Odisha
163.article_body: About 60,000 Anganwadi centres have been shut as Anganwadi workers have gone on an indefinite dharna in Odisha. Reports said that the workers are demanding status of government employees and ₹18,000 for Anganwadi workers and ₹9,000 for their assistants. Their demands also include compensation of ₹5 lakh to family of an Anganwadi worker in case of death during service period.

164.title: Not yet: Rana Daggubati on wife Miheeka's pregnancy rumours
164.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati has denied the rumours that he and his wife Miheeka Daggubati are expecting their first child. Reacting to the claims that his wife Miheeka is pregnant, Rana said, "Not yet...If I am having a baby, I'll be sure." Rana spoke about the rumours in conversation with singer Kanika Kapoor, who had congratulated him on the news.

165.title: It looked like a bad tackle but he carried on: Southgate on Kane's injury vs Iran
165.article_body: England manager Gareth Southgate has said Harry Kane is fine after the England captain went down following a tackle during their FIFA World Cup match against Iran. Kane eventually got up and played, but he was substituted in the 75th minute for Callum Wilson. "We took him off because we felt it was a moment...we could do that," said Southgate.

166.title: UP CM Yogi, Akhilesh pay tribute to Mulayam Singh on his birth anniversary
166.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath and SP President Akhilesh Yadav paid tribute to ex-CM Mulayam Singh on his birth anniversary. Akhilesh tweeted a photo of him and referred to him as the 'son of soil'. The Samajwadi Party is also commemorating his birth anniversary as 'Dharti Putra Diwas'. Mulayam Singh was born in 1939 in Saifai, Etawah.

167.title: Malayalam & Hindi versions of Drishyam 3 to release on same day: Report
167.article_body: The Malayalam and the Hindi versions of 'Drishyam 3' will reportedly be released on the same day. This comes after Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2', which is a remake of a Malayalam film, earned ₹64 crore on its first weekend. "The idea of the third part was originally there as well, the stupendous collection has only strengthened it," a source stated.

168.title: 23-yr-old son of Telangana minister's ex-aide dies by suicide in Hyd
168.article_body: The 23-year-old son of a former personal assistant of Telangana Excise and Prohibition Minister Srinivas Goud died by suicide on Monday in Hyderabad. Akshay Kumar, who was accused of taking money to allot houses under a government scheme, hanged himself at his sister's house. Two months ago, a case had been registered against Kumar in connection with the scam.

169.title: Law student records girls in university toilets in B'luru, booked
169.article_body: A 21-year-old law student has been booked for allegedly recording videos of girls in the toilets of a private university in Bengaluru, police said on Tuesday. Earlier, the man had been caught peeping into the girls' toilet and was let off after he submitted an apology letter. When he repeated the act two days later, the management called the police.

170.title: B'luru man sues Reliance Retail for charging ₹24.9 for carry bag, wins ₹7,000 compensation
170.article_body: A Bengaluru-based advocate won a case against Reliance Retail after he was forced to purchase a carry bag for ₹24.9 after shopping for items worth ₹2,007. The city consumer court ruled that Reliance Retail must refund ₹24.9 to the customer and also pay him a compensation of ₹5,000 along with ₹2,000 towards his court expenses.

171.title: Interned at Mukul Anand's production house, got ₹5,000: Varun Dhawan
171.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan revealed that he interned at Mukul Anand's production house for which he was paid ₹5,000. He recalled that during his internship, he got a chance to meet Sania Mirza and revealed that her mother had scolded him for getting an apple for the tennis star. "I think her mother thought I was cracked," he shared.

172.title: Special cell was made for Shah: AAP leader on Jain's massage videos
172.article_body: After reports claimed that the man seen in videos giving massage to Delhi minister Satyendar Jain is not a physiotherapist but a rape accused, AAP leader Gopal Rai said a special cell was made in Gujarat for Amit Shah. "The main issue is that the people of Delhi have decided to make AAP win in the MCD polls," Rai added.

173.title: Mumbai Police files chargesheet against Raj Kundra in pornography case
173.article_body: Mumbai Police has filed over 1000-page chargesheet against Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra and others concerning the pornography case.
