Kundra's advocate Prashant Patil said they would follow the legal procedure to collect the chargesheet and added that his client has nothing to do with the said crime. Last year, Kundra was arrested for allegedly producing pornographic films.

174.title: We were in tears as B'wood films were performing so badly: Manoj Desai
174.article_body: Discussing the success of 'Drishyam 2', Manoj Desai, who is the Executive Director of Maratha Mandir Cinema said, "We were in tears because Bollywood films were performing so badly." "After...many years, a film's delivered houseful shows," added Desai. "[This is the first instance in a long period of time where]...we're bathing in the waters of...river Ganga with producers," he stated.

175.title: 3 BJP leaders booked in Gujarat's Vadodara for making casteist remarks
175.article_body: Three BJP leaders, Biren Shah, Vishal and Amit Solanki, have been booked under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act in Gujarat's Vadodara for allegedly insulting and making casteist remarks against a tribal man. According to reports, Biren Shah threatened the victim to remove his vegetable cart once the state Assembly polls are over.

176.title: Twins born in US from embryos frozen 30 years ago, pic goes viral
176.article_body: A couple from US has welcomed twins born from embryos frozen on April 22, 1992. The National Embryo Donation Center believes the embryos are the longest-frozen to have resulted in a live birth. The embryos were initially created for an anonymous married couple and were kept at a fertility laboratory before being donated in 2007.

177.title: 21-yr-old law student records video of girls in Bengaluru university toilet; case filed
177.article_body: A case has been registered against a 21-year-old law student of a private university in Bengaluru for allegedly peeping into the girls' toilet and recording a video of them, police said on Tuesday. The accused was caught peeping inside the toilet in the past and was let off with a warning after he submitted an apology letter.

178.title: Congress to file complaint over video of girl with PM praising BJP
178.article_body: Congress will file a complaint against PM Narendra Modi after BJP tweeted a video of a girl praising the party while posing with the PM. Congress said that it will reach out to the National Commission for Protection Of Child Rights on Tuesday and file the complaint. TMC accused BJP of using a minor for its election campaign in Gujarat.

179.title: 1 killed, 29 hurt after bomb explodes in police compound in Thailand
179.article_body: At least one person has been killed and 29 others have been injured after a car bomb exploded inside a police compound in southern Thailand on Tuesday. "We're still clearing the area and the number of injured could increase," police said. Seven people were injured after explosions and fires ripped through at least 17 locations in southern Thailand in August.

180.title: Who has scored the most goals for Argentina in FIFA World Cup history?
180.article_body: Ex-Argentina forward Gabriel Batistuta holds the record for scoring the most goals for his country in FIFA World Cup history, with a total of 10 goals. He's followed by Guillermo Stabile and ex-captain Diego Maradona, both of whom scored eight goals each. Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi has scored the joint third-highest six goals along with Mario Kempes.

181.title: Retired banker cheated of ₹33 lakh by investment firm in Pune
181.article_body: A case has been filed after a 71-year-old retired bank manager was allegedly cheated of ₹33 lakh by an investment firm run by a father-son duo in Pune. The bank manager had reportedly invested all his retirement money after the duo promised to double his investment. According to the complainant, the duo stopped taking his calls later.

182.title: Warner gives his gloves to young fan after slamming his 44th international hundred
182.article_body: Australia opener David Warner gave his gloves to a young fan in the stands after slamming his 44th international hundred in the third ODI against England in Melbourne on Tuesday. Warner did the gesture while walking towards the dressing room after getting out in the 39th over. Warner scored 106(102), his first international hundred after 1,042 days.

183.title: Reliance could create India's 5th largest financial services firm: Macquarie
183.article_body: Reliance Industries' plans to demerge its financial services business and list it could create India's fifth-largest financial services firm, Macquarie Capital Securities said. RIL plans to demerge its financial services undertaking into Reliance Strategic Investments and rename it Jio Financial Services (JFSL). HDFC Bank, SBI, ICICI Bank, and Axis Bank are the top four companies in the business.

184.title: Disney's outgoing CEO Bob Chapek to get $23 million as exit package: Report
184.article_body: Disney's outgoing CEO Bob Chapek is likely to receive exit payments and benefits worth more than $23 million, Bloomberg reported. Chapek is entitled to collect a salary for the full duration of his term, even if he's ousted prematurely, as per his contract. He's also entitled to pension accumulated over his decades-long career at Disney, which stands at $16.9 million.

185.title: English cricketer Laurie Evans fails dope test, loses BBL contract; denies wrongdoing
185.article_body: English batter Laurie Evans has returned a positive result from a sample sent for the anti-doping test during the second edition of The Hundred in August-September 2022. Evans, however, has denied taking any banned substance. "I was shocked...I don't know what caused the positive test," he stated. BBL's Perth Scorchers have terminated Evans' contract over the dope test result.

186.title: Thane resident killed after tree branch crashes down on car, case filed
186.article_body: A 38-year-old Thane resident died after a tree branch came crashing down on his car in Mumbai's Worli. "Metro works are going on in Worli...and the branch collapsed after a truck with sharp machinery for excavating rocks hit some branches of the tree adjoining the road," a civic official said. Police have lodged FIR against the truck driver.

187.title: SUV overturns as driver loses control due to pothole in UP; 5 dead
187.article_body: Five people were killed and at least six others injured after an SUV overturned into a ditch in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Tuesday, police said. The driver of the SUV, which had 12 people on board, lost control due to a pothole on the road, an inspector said. Four of the deceased have been identified, police added.

188.title: Man catches one of the world's largest goldfish weighing over 30 kg in France, pic surfaces
188.article_body: A British fisherman named Andy Hackett has caught one of the world's largest goldfish weighing more than 30 kg in France. The fish, which is a cross between the leather carp and the koi carp, is nicknamed as the Carrot after its orange colour and was put into the Bluewater Lakes in Champagne, France 20 years ago.

189.title: 36 bridges found unfit for traffic in safety audit in Uttarakhand
189.article_body: As many as 36 bridges in Uttarakhand have been found to be unfit for traffic following a safety audit. The audit was carried out on the state CM's directions in the wake of Morbi bridge collapse tragedy. "Instructions have been given...to set up a bridge bank so that new bridges can be constructed," State Public Works Department Principal Secretary said.

190.title: Russian envoy urges Turkey to show restraint in Syria: Reports
190.article_body: Russia has urged Turkey to show restraint in its use of military force in Syria and keep tensions from escalating, Russian news agencies reported. Russian envoy Alexander Lavrentyev reportedly said that the country would work with interested parties in finding a peaceful solution to the "Kurdish issue". This comes after Turkish warplanes carried out strikes in Syria and Iraq.

191.title: Hacker, known for 1st unlocking iPhone, gets 12-week internship at Twitter in US
191.article_body: George Hotz, a 33-year-old American security hacker, has secured a 12-week internship at Twitter after he made a pitch to work for the "cost of living" in San Francisco, where Twitter headquarters are situated. He tweeted on Tuesday that he'll work on Twitter's search feature. Hotz is known for being the first person to unlock an Apple iPhone in 2007.

192.title: CM Kejriwal should apologise to nation: BJP leader on Jain's massage video
192.article_body: Reacting to jailed AAP leader Satyendar Jain's massage video which went viral, BJP's Gaurav Bhatia said Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal should apologise to the nation. "Satyendar Jain shouldn't retain a Delhi minister post for a minute anymore," Bhatia added. "If Arvind Kejriwal is too weak to dismiss Satyendar Jain, then the CM should resign," Bhatia stated.

193.title: India stands with Indonesia: PM Modi after 162 die in earthquake
193.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has expressed grief after Indonesia was hit by an earthquake on Monday, that claimed 162 lives. "Saddened by the loss of lives and damage to property from the earthquake in Indonesia. Deepest condolences to the victims and their families," he tweeted, adding that India stands with Indonesia. PM Modi was recently in Indonesia for the G20 summit.

194.title: Farhan said 'Give me whatever comes to your mind': Rakeysh on 'Bhaag...'
194.article_body: Talking about the film 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' which was based on sprinter Milkha Singh, the movie's director Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra said, "Farhan Akhtar said, '[Give me] whatever comes to your mind'." "Sonam Kapoor took Rs 11 to act," Rakeysh had previously stated. Discussing 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag', Akshay Kumar had earlier said, "I am very guilty of not doing [it]."

195.title: I don't fear anyone, no one needs to fear me: Shashi Tharoor
195.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor met senior leaders of IUML in Panakkad today and said that he fears no one and sees no reason for anyone to fear him. This comes at a time when Tharoor's Malabar tour is not appreciated by some leaders of the Congress party. Tharoor said that the controversy surrounding his tour was unnecessary.

196.title: Every 11 minutes, a woman or a girl is killed by intimate partner or family: UN chief
196.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has stated that every 11 minutes, a woman or a girl is killed by an intimate partner or family member. "Violence against women and girls is the most pervasive human rights violation in the world," Guterres said, adding that other stresses, including COVID-19 pandemic and economic turmoil, lead to more physical and verbal abuse against women.

197.title: Respect our core interests, don't cross 'red line' on Taiwan: China to US
197.article_body: Chinese Defence Minister Wei Fenghe on Tuesday told US counterpart Lloyd Austin that Taiwan is at the core of China's core interests and was a "red line" that must not be crossed. The US must respect China's core interests and should adopt a rational, practical policy towards China and get relations between both countries back on track, Fenghe said.

198.title: 32-yr-old man shot dead in Ghaziabad after brawl at birthday party
198.article_body: A 32-year-old man was shot dead over some minor issue which occurred at a birthday party hosted by his neighbour in Indrapuri, the police said. The deceased man allegedly sought the number of a woman at the party after which an argument broke out. Further, the suspect woman and her accomplices were alleged to have opened fire at the man.

199.title: Met him in plane, was difficult as he was married with 2 kids: Neena on husband
199.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said that she met her husband Vivek Mehra in a plane. "That was a very nice phase. It was difficult because he was already married with two children. It was a tough time for me, a very very tough time...that time has passed," she added. She also said she can do anything for her daughter Masaba Gupta.

200.title: China's JD.com to cut salaries of 2,000 managers by 10% to 20%
200.article_body: China's JD.com will cut the salaries of about 2,000 senior managers by 10% to 20% next year. It is also planning to allocate $1.4 billion for a fund to help its staff and those at recently-acquired courier firm Deppon Logistics with buying homes. JD's Founder Richard Liu will also personally donate $14 million to a fund for the employees' children.

201.title: Mumbai Anti Narcotics Cell seizes drugs worth ₹30 lakh, 2 arrested
201.article_body: The Bandra unit of the Mumbai Anti Narcotics Cell has arrested two drug suppliers from the Jogeshwari area and seized over 1 kg of charas, valued at over ₹30 lakh in the international market, from their possession, Mumbai Police said. A case has been registered under the NDPS Act. Further investigation is underway, Mumbai Police added.

202.title: ASI to probe video of man allegedly offering namaz at Taj Mahal
202.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) will conduct an investigation into the authenticity of a viral video allegedly showing a man offering namaz in a garden said to be the premises of Taj Mahal. "None of [ASI staff] at Taj Mahal saw such happening. I was also present...on Sunday but came across no such incident," ASI Agra Circle Superintending Archaeologist said.

203.title: FTX, its execs, ex-CEO's parents bought $121-mn Bahamian properties: Report
203.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX, his parents and senior executives of the firm bought at least 19 Bahamian properties worth nearly $121 million over the past two years, Reuters reported citing records. FTX Property Holdings bought 15 properties worth nearly $100 million. Its most expensive purchase was a $30-million penthouse at a resort where Tiger Woods hosts a golf tournament every year.

204.title: Missing Bengaluru techie, whose child was found dead, traced to TN
204.article_body: The missing Bengaluru techie, whose two-and-a-half-year-old daughter was found dead in a lake in Kolar district days ago, has been traced to Tamil Nadu's Vellore, said police officials. The man, Rahul Parmar, was traced after he called his father-in-law claiming that he was kidnapped and his daughter was taken away by unidentified people. The police are searching for him.

205.title: Report says Musk asked Twitter staff to send weekly update of their work, he reacts
205.article_body: In an internal memo to employees, Elon Musk has reportedly asked the staff to send a weekly email update of their work, wherein they must include what project are they working on or "code samples" and what they have been trying to accomplish. Responding to a tweet about this, Musk wrote, "Perhaps not unreasonable to know if anything was accomplished."

206.title: Quality of life important for development, not just economic index: Stalin
206.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday said that the development should not be determined on economic indicators alone, it should hinge on the quality of life and happiness index. Furthermore, he said, the state government has been striving with the noble objective of development for all and development in all sectors.

207.title: Texas to send armoured vehicles to US-Mexico border to 'repel' migrants
207.article_body: Texas will deploy military armoured personnel carriers along its border with Mexico to "repel" undocumented migrants trying to enter the US, authorities said. This comes a month before a COVID-19 health measure blocking asylum-seekers from entering the country ends, which may lead to a surge in asylum-seekers. Texas Governor Greg Abbott has said he'll treat illegal immigration like an 'invasion'.

208.title: 2 Estonians arrested for alleged role in $575 million crypto fraud
208.article_body: Two Estonian citizens have been arrested in the city of Tallinn for their alleged involvement in a $575 million cryptocurrency fraud, the US Justice Department said. Sergei Potapenko and Ivan Turõgin allegedly tricked hundreds of thousands of people into investing in a cryptocurrency bank called Polybius and buy contracts for a mining service HashFlare between 2015 and 2019, police said.

209.title: ₹36 cr sanctioned for development, construction at 125-yr-old Hyd market
209.article_body: Quli Qutub Shah Urban Development Authority has prepared a special plan to restore the glory of Hyderabad's Murgi Chowk Market which was built 125 years ago. Reports said ₹36 crore has been sanctioned for development and construction works in market area. The plan is also to construct a G+1 building with a restaurant on the first floor of the market.

210.title: Kajol's family didn't want her to act after marriage with Ajay: Suneel
210.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan shared that when Kajol was about to get married to Ajay Devgn, her mother Tanuja said that her family didn't want her to pursue her acting career at that moment. "She said, 'You know, she's getting married...they don't want her to pursue a career'," he recalled. Kajol was supposed to star in Suneel's directorial film 'Jaanwar'.

211.title: Suspect in Colorado shooting carried out hate crime: Colorado Mayor
211.article_body: The gunman, who attacked an LGBTQ nightclub in the US state of Colorado, is believed to have carried out a hate crime, Colorado Mayor John Suthers said. Anderson Aldrich is suspected of five counts of first-degree murder and five counts of bias-motivated crimes causing bodily injury, the Associated Press reported citing court records. Five people were killed in the attack.

212.title: I used to be one of them, I can see myself in them: Kartik on fans' attention
212.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that when he is surrounded by his fans at a theatre or any event, he can see himself in them. "I used to be one of them myself, so I know how earnest they are. I just love my fans and 'fanception' is a word that truly captures my love and emotion for them," he added.

213.title: Rashtrapati Bhavan to be open 5 days a week to public from Dec 1
213.article_body: The Rashtrapati Bhavan will be open to the public for five days a week instead of just two days from December 1, a spokesperson for the President said. Guided tours will be provided to the visitors between 10 am and 4 pm every Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday, except on holidays.

214.title: Parts of Bengaluru to see scheduled power cuts till Thursday
214.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will see scheduled power cuts from Tuesday to Thursday owing to certain projects scheduled by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM). On Tuesday, areas including Kuvempu Nagar and Huskur will be impacted, while on Wednesday, Hondada Circle, Jali Nagara and other areas will be affected. Places, including Mandipet and Mahaveer Road will be impacted on Thursday.

215.title: Pentagon Chief meets Chinese counterpart, discusses its 'dangerous behaviour'
215.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin held a meeting with his Chinese counterpart Wei Fenghe in Cambodia where he emphasised the need to improve crisis communication while raising concerns about "increasingly dangerous" behaviour by Chinese military aircraft. This was the leaders' first meeting since US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan in August, a move that angered China.

216.title: The big favourites never win WC, details make champions: Argentina manager
216.article_body: Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni said the teams that are considered as "big favourites" for an edition of the FIFA World Cup "never" end up winning the tournament. "Details will make champions and not necessarily the team that plays the best," added Scaloni. "England [are] a candidate but I...[won't] say that the Arab teams are a step below," he stated.

217.title: FTX customer sues NBA champions Golden State Warriors over collapse
217.article_body: NBA champions Golden State Warriors were sued by an FTX customer who accused the former of fraudulently promoting the now-bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange. Other defendants include FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried and Caroline Ellison, who led FTX's trading firm Alameda Research. Elliott Lam accused the defendants of falsely representing that FTX was a "viable and safe way to invest in crypto".

218.title: Delhi Police allowed to conduct Aftab's polygraph test: Reports
218.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday allowed Delhi Police to conduct a polygraph test on Aftab Amin Poonawala, who is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in May, claimed reports. His police custody was also extended by four days today. His legal counsel said a narco test will be conducted soon. Aftab and Shraddha met through a dating app.

219.title: Dosti se zyada kuch nai hota: Russian envoy as he describes Indo-Russia relation
219.article_body: As India and Russia celebrated 75 years of diplomatic relations, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov described the relationship between two nations in Hindi. "There is a popular saying in India, 'Dosti se zyada kuch bhi nahi hota.' A very precise characteristic of the trusted and friendly character of Russia-India strategic partnership," he said.

220.title: K'taka govt to fight legal battle over boundary dispute with Maharashtra
220.article_body: Karnataka government is set to fight a legal battle over a boundary dispute with Maharashtra in the Supreme Court. CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the state has formed a team of senior advocates to fight the case. "What has happened in Maharashtra is that the border dispute itself has become a political object," said Bommai.

221.title: 1,349 candidates to contest in upcoming MCD polls; majority are women
221.article_body: A total of 1,349 candidates will contest in the upcoming MCD elections, according to Delhi State Election Commission (DSEC). Out of the total candidates, 709 are women and 640 are men, who will contest for the post of councillors in 250 wards. AAP has 140 women candidates followed by BJP and Congress at 137 and 134 candidates, respectively.

222.title: Twitter hits another all-time high, adds 1.6 mn DAUs in a week: Musk
222.article_body: Twitter owner Elon Musk revealed on Monday that the platform has added 1.6 million daily active users (DAUs) in the past week. "Another all-time high," he added. Earlier, Musk shared that Twitter's usage was at an all-time high and shared graphs showing a surge in Twitter's monetizable daily active users globally and in the US.

223.title: Authorities suggest dismantling selfie point after car pileup on Pune highway
223.article_body: After 48 cars got piled up on the Pune-Bengaluru highway on Sunday, high officials of Pune Police, NHAI and PMC visited the spot on Monday. Later, the authorities proposed reducing the gradient of the slope on the Navale Bridge and the curvature of the highway by-pass to improve safety. Dismantling the selfie point next to the bridge was also suggested.

224.title: US Prez Biden pardons turkeys 'Chocolate' & 'Chip' for Thanksgiving
224.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday pardoned two Thanksgiving turkeys named Chocolate and Chip while cracking jokes about his political party's better-than-expected performance in this month's midterm elections. The large white birds, each weighing nearly 23 kg, were named after Joe Biden's favourite ice cream flavour. The White House turkey pardon is a tradition that dates back decades.

225.title: Pune police arrest sextortion case 'mastermind' from Rajasthan
225.article_body: The Pune City Police arrested the alleged "mastermind" behind several sextortion crimes in the country from Rajasthan's Alwar. The 29-year-old accused, Anwar Suban Khan, is involved in the case involving a 19-year-old youth from Pune, who died by suicide after being blackmailed by a "woman" with whom he came in contact through social media, police said.

226.title: David Warner smashes a hundred in international cricket after 1,042 days
226.article_body: Australia opener David Warner on Tuesday scored 106 runs off 102 deliveries against England in the third ODI in Melbourne. It is Warner's 19th hundred in ODI cricket. Further, it is his first hundred across formats in international cricket in 1,042 days. Warner slammed eight fours and two sixes in his knock.

227.title: 'Twitter may set up engineering team in India to decentralise things,' says Musk: Report
227.article_body: In a meeting with Twitter employees, Elon Musk reportedly suggested that it would be a good idea to "somewhat decentralise things" by setting up engineering teams in Japan, India, Indonesia, and Brazil. Musk also said that the company is done with layoffs and is actively hiring for roles in the engineering and sales department, the report added.

228.title: Largest book publisher Penguin scraps $2.2 bn merger deal with Simon & Schuster
228.article_body: World's largest book publisher Penguin Random House has scrapped a $2.2-billion deal to merge with smaller American rival Simon & Schuster. The development comes weeks after a US judge blocked the merger, saying it would "substantially" hurt competition for books in the publishing market. Notably, Penguin will pay a $200 million termination fee to Simon & Schuster's parent company Paramount.

229.title: Priyanka Gandhi to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Wednesday
229.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has confirmed that party General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi will be participating in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Wednesday. He said that Tuesday is a rest day for the Yatra, which will resume on Wednesday. "Priyanka Gandhi will participate for four days," Jairam Ramesh tweeted in Hindi. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will enter Madhya Pradesh tomorrow.

230.title: Beer maker Bira91 raises $70 million from Japan's Kirin Holdings
230.article_body: Beer maker Bira91 has secured $70 million in a Series D funding round led by Japanese beverage company, Kirin Holdings. After the funding round, Kirin's shareholding in the company reached 20% from 10%. Bira91 has so far raised over $200 million from investors including Sequoia Capital India, Sofina and Kirin Holdings. The beer maker was founded by Ankur Jain.

231.title: Kaynes Technology stock lists at 32% premium over IPO price
231.article_body: Electronics manufacturing company Kaynes Technology India's stock was listed at a 32% premium over its issue price of ₹587 on Tuesday. It started trading at ₹778/share on the NSE and ₹775/share on the BSE. The ₹858-crore IPO of the Mysuru-based company was subscribed 34.16 times during the November 10-14 period. Qualified institutional buyers bought shares 98.47 times the allotted quota.

232.title: Boman Irani avoided surgery and bounced back in 3 weeks: QI Spine
232.article_body: QI Spine shared that their treatment process combines the expertise of 300+ doctors backed by data intelligence to offer the most accurate diagnosis along with Digital Spine Analysis that helps identify weak muscles and treat them without surgery. In addition, they mentioned that their online Spine Health test also helps find the root cause of the problem.

233.title: Paytm shares hit new all-time low, stock trading 78% below IPO price
233.article_body: Shares of Paytm's parent company One97 Communications hit an all-time low of ₹483.30 as they declined by 10% on BSE Sensex in Tuesday’s intra-day trade. The stock previously touched a low of ₹511 on May 12. In the last year, Paytm's share price has dropped 64% and the stock is currently trading 78% below its IPO price of ₹2,150/share.

234.title: Kartik used to meet me often over teas in office: Anees on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
234.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said that actor Kartik Aaryan is great at making connections. "I remember how he used to meet me so often over teas at my office, while we were still writing 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', so we both become comfortable with each other and understand our tuning," he said, adding that Aaryan is very hard-working.

235.title: India announce playing XI for their last T20I of the year against New Zealand
235.article_body: New Zealand stand-in captain Tim Southee won the toss and elected to bat first against India in the third T20I in Napier. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Harshal Patel replacing Washington Sundar. The match is India's last T20I of 2022. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

236.title: Why doubt Delhi Police: HC as it dismisses plea for CBI probe into Shraddha case
236.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday dismissed with costs a PIL that sought to transfer the probe of the Shraddha Walkar murder case from Delhi Police to CBI. "Why should we doubt Delhi Police?" HC remarked. It also called the plea a 'publicity interest litigation'. The petitioner claimed investigation details were revealed to the media, which isn't permissible by law.

237.title: PM Modi distributes 71,056 appointment letters at Rozgar Mela
237.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday distributed 71,056 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela, saying, "You are getting this new responsibility in a special era. The country has entered Amrit Kaal." He added that youths are the biggest strength of India. The PM also launched the Karmayogi Prarambh module, an online orientation course for all new appointees.

238.title: More than 30 TMC MLAs in contact with our party: Bengal BJP leader
238.article_body: West Bengal BJP MLA Agnimitra Paul claimed that Trinamool Congress government led by Mamata Banerjee will collapse soon. Paul said that more than 30 TMC MLAs are in contact with BJP in the state. "There will be a khela here in December...They know that their government will not continue for long after December. Their existence is at stake," she added.

239.title: A British girl cried, said 'Why did you beat SRK so much in Baazigar?': Dalip
239.article_body: Recalling his experience while interacting with a British girl, actor Dalip Tahil said, "She was visibly agitated upon seeing me...[and] asked, 'Why did you beat Shah Rukh Khan so much in Baazigar?’. I was taken aback!" "She even had tears in her eyes. I asked her...'Didn't he beat me as well?' She replied, 'That is okay'," added Dalip.

240.title: BJP uses 'vanvasi' for tribals as it doesn't want them in cities: Rahul
240.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP, alleging that the party uses the term "vanvasi" for tribals because it does not want them in cities. "[They do not want to] see your children becoming engineers, doctors...speak English…In another five or 10 years, all the jungles will be in the hands of...industrialists," said Rahul.

241.title: Musk says there are no plans to move Twitter's HQ to Texas: Report
241.article_body: Elon Musk has told Twitter employees that there are "no plans" to move the firm's headquarters to Texas, The Verge reported citing recordings. However, he added it could make sense to be "dual-headquartered" in California and Texas. Musk also said moving the headquarters to Texas "would play into the idea that Twitter has gone from being left-wing to right-wing".

242.title: Was hoping he would run for US President: Netflix CEO on Disney CEO
242.article_body: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings reacted to Bob Iger being named Disney’s new CEO, saying, “Ugh. I had been hoping Iger would run for President. He is amazing.” Iger held the role of Disney’s CEO for 15 years before retiring from the firm 11 months ago. He will now serve in the role for two years.

243.title: Men's health startup Bonatra raises ₹5.5 crore in pre-seed funding
243.article_body: Wellness startup Bonatra﻿, which deals with andropause, has raised ₹5.5 crore in a pre-seed round led by ITI Growth Opportunities Fund. The doctor-led IoMT startup was founded by Rahul Kishore Singh, Manjari Chandra, Ramanpreet Singh and Amit Acharya in March 2022. NestAway and Helloworld Founder Jitendra Jagadev and BlackBuck Founder Rajesh Yabaji, among others, participated in the round.

244.title: JioCinema trolled as fans face issues streaming FIFA World Cup, company apologises
244.article_body: JioCinema was trolled online after people faced buffering issues during the live-streaming of the inaugural FIFA World Cup match on its app. "Can't even watch 1 min...Very disappointed," wrote a Twitter user, while another called it "worst viewing experience ever". Taking to Twitter, JioCinema apologised for "any inconvenience" faced by users and said it is working on fixing the issue.

245.title: Player who scored USA's first 2022 FIFA WC goal is Liberia President George Weah's son
245.article_body: Forward Tim Weah, who scored USA's first goal in 2022 FIFA World Cup, is Liberia President George Weah's son. George was himself a footballer and was the first African to win Ballon d'Or. George played for clubs like Monaco, PSG, AC Milan, Chelsea and Manchester City. Tim, 22, was born in USA and plays club football for Lille in France.

246.title: COVID-19 cases hit record high in Beijing; parks & museums closed
246.article_body: Beijing on Tuesday shut parks, shopping malls and museums as the Chinese capital recorded its highest rise in daily coronavirus cases. Beijing reported 1,438 new local cases on Tuesday, up from 962 on Sunday. Beijing has also tightened rules for entering the city, requiring people arriving from elsewhere in the country to undergo three days of COVID-19 testing.

247.title: Dignity of Guv's post has ended in Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut
247.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said a Governor is neutral and shows dignity in his words and conduct. His statement came following Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's remarks on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. "The dignity of the post of Governor has ended in Maharashtra because BJP has made the Raj Bhavan its party headquarters," Raut added.

248.title: Satyendar Jain moves Delhi court demanding dry fruits, dates in jail
248.article_body: Jailed AAP leader Satyendar Jain has moved a Delhi court demanding food items as per his religious beliefs, including dry fruits, mixed seeds, fruits and dates. The plea said that Jain is on a religious fast for the last six months and such food items are necessary for his nourishment and survival.

249.title: Man in touch with Mangaluru blast accused picked up from B'luru
249.article_body: A man who was allegedly in touch with the main accused in Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case was picked up by police from Bengaluru on Monday. He was sent to his native place Mysuru as police needed to take him to different areas for investigation, an official said. Meanwhile, another person was detained in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris and brought to Karnataka.

250.title: Punjab grants ₹38.53 crore to set up toy libraries in govt schools
250.article_body: Punjab government has released a grant of ₹38.53 crore for setting up toy libraries for pre-primary students at government schools across the state. The grant has been issued to impart education through modern tools in 12,846 schools, state School Education Minister Harjot Singh Bains said. He added that it can be used to teach students about health care, cleanliness, etc.

251.title: 4 students arrested for torturing, killing pregnant stray dog in Delhi
251.article_body: Four students of South East Delhi's Don Bosco Technical Institute were arrested for allegedly beating a pregnant dog to death in the New Friends Colony area. Police registered a case after a purported video of the incident, showing a group of men thrashing the dog and later dragging her across the field, was widely circulated on social media.

252.title: Whatever mistake I made was in the heat of the moment: Aftab to court in Shraddha case
252.article_body: Aftab Amin Poonawala, who is arrested for the murder of his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, on Tuesday told a court in Delhi that "whatever mistake I made was in the heat of the moment". He also told the court that he is cooperating in the investigation. He further told the court that he is having difficulty in recalling the incident.

253.title: Told Vivian 'If you don't want the child, I won't have it': Neena on pregnancy
253.article_body: Recalling the conversation over her pregnancy with ex-West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards who was in a relationship with her, actress Neena Gupta said, "I...[told] him that if you don't want this child, then I won't have it." "Everyone told me, 'How can you do it alone?' because he was...married," added Neena. Neena decided to give birth to her daughter Masaba.

254.title: Zoom shares plunge after company cuts annual revenue forecast
254.article_body: Zoom Video Communications' Nasdaq-listed shares plunged over 6% in extended trading after the California-based company cut its annual revenue forecast on Monday. Zoom now expects to generate up to $4.38 billion in annual revenue, compared with an earlier outlook of up to $4.40 billion, as its online business declines. Meanwhile, the firm's third-quarter revenue rose 5% to $1.1 billion.

255.title: 2 buses set on fire in South Africa's Cape Town during taxi strike
255.article_body: Two buses were set on fire in South Africa's Cape Town as local taxi associations began a two-day strike against termination of an incentive program. The Western Cape provincial government announced termination of the scheme, that encouraged safe driving practises and curtailed illegal operations, due to lack of funding. The scheme was cancelled after a little more than a year.

256.title: I admire Kohli, but Surya is someone I'd strive to be like: NZ's Finn Allen
256.article_body: New Zealand opener Finn Allen, during an interview, said that he admires Virat Kohli but would strive to be like Suryakumar Yadav. "I really love watching Suryakumar play...Some of the shots he plays are out of this world," he stated. Finn, who has played 24 T20Is so far, was dismissed for a duck in the second T20I against India.

257.title: Twitter to soon encrypt DMs and add video, voice chat: Report
257.article_body: In a meeting with Twitter employees, CEO Elon Musk said that the company would soon encrypt direct messages (DMs) and work to add encrypted video and voice calling between accounts, The Verge reported. Musk also added that "we also want to have the ability to do voice and video chat via DMs," according to the report.

258.title: One more suspected death of child due to measles in Mumbai, toll rises to 9
258.article_body: One more child is suspected to have died due to measles in Mumbai, taking the death toll to nine since October 26. A 15-month-old girl died due to the infection on November 19. "Mumbai has reported nine measles deaths, of which one is suspected and will be reviewed by the committee," said a BMC official.

259.title: Mohali policewoman caught taking ₹20,000 bribe from rape victim
259.article_body: A woman Assistant Sub-inspector (ASI) posted in Mohali, identified as Parveen Kaur, allegedly took a bribe of ₹20,000 from a rape victim for arresting the accused. The act was caught in the CCTV cameras installed in the victim's house. The footage surfaced on social media, after which the policewoman was booked under the Prevention of Corruption Act.

260.title: Andhra woman delivers baby on road after hospital denies admission
260.article_body: A woman delivered a baby on the road in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati after a hospital allegedly denied to admit her as no one was accompanying her. A video of the incident which purportedly shows the woman delivering the baby while people hold a bedsheet over her has surfaced online. A primary healthcare worker had reportedly helped the woman.

261.title: Arrests being made without reason, burdens judiciary: Ex-CJI Lalit
261.article_body: Former Chief Justice of India UU Lalit said that in recent times, arrests are being made without a reason and civil disputes are being projected as criminal matters. "This puts a burden on the judicial system," he said at a Bombay High Court event. He added that 80% of Indian prisoners are undertrials, while the conviction rate is 27%.

262.title: Ajay's Bholaa to have 3 instalments, Salman to star in sequel: Report
262.article_body: Ajay Devgn's upcoming film 'Bholaa' will reportedly be made into a franchise with three instalment films. The sequel will reportedly star Salman Khan. As per a report, Salman will play a crucial role alongside Ajay Devgn. "The second and third part will not necessarily be titled 'Bholaa', but will be set in the same universe," a source told Mid-day.

263.title: India reports 294 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 6,209
263.article_body: India reported 294 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 406 fresh cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in India stands at 6,209. The death toll in the country so far has reached 5,30,591, according to the ministry.

264.title: Pic of Earth's view from Moon released by NASA
264.article_body: NASA has released a picture of the Earth clicked by its Orion Spacecraft that has completed its closest fly-by of the Moon. "Orion Spacecraft completed its closest fly-by of the Moon...81 miles above the lunar surface, traveling 5,102 mph," NASA said. Orion will enter distant retrograde orbit beyond the Moon on Friday, the space agency stated.

265.title: No one knew anything about me, can't count rejections I faced: Aamir's niece
265.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's niece Zayn Marie Khan said that she can't even count the number of rejections she has faced in the industry. "I was trying to come into this career on my own...I do have a family that I am related to, and a lot of times when I went to audition nobody knew anything about me," she added.

266.title: Dell's operating income in Q3 jumps 68% to $1.8 bn, revenue falls 6%
266.article_body: Dell on Monday said its operating income jumped 68% to record $1.8 billion in the third quarter of fiscal 2023 as demand for servers climbed and easing supply-chain pressures helped reduce costs. The company's total revenue dropped 6% to $24.72 billion in the quarter. Net income fell 93% to $241 million due to a $1 billion settlement of a lawsuit.

267.title: Man falls from cliff while taking selfies, dies in Faridabad
267.article_body: A 42-year-old man has died after he fell down 200 feet from a cliff while taking selfies in the forest area of the Aravallis in Faridabad, police said. The body was recovered on Sunday following an overnight rescue operation, police added. "At the cliff, [the deceased] had also spoken to his wife over a video call," an SHO said.

268.title: 14-yr-old girl raped, murdered in France, 31-yr-old suspect arrested
268.article_body: A 14-year-old girl in southern France has been raped and murdered, police said. A 31-year-old man has been arrested who allegedly forced the girl into his car after she left school in the town of Tonneins. Her body was found in an abandoned house. The murder comes weeks after a 12-year-old girl was raped and killed in Paris.

269.title: Israel's Netanyahu wins defamation case against ex-PM Ehud Olmert
269.article_body: Israeli Prime Minister-designate Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday won a defamation lawsuit against ex-PM Ehud Olmert. He had sued Olmert after the latter alleged that Netanyahu, his wife Sara, and son Yair all suffered from "mental illness". Olmert became PM in 2006 but stepped down in 2009 as he faced corruption allegations. He was replaced by Netanyahu that year.

270.title: Pak intruder killed by BSF along border in Jammu, another arrested
270.article_body: A BSF official said that an intruder coming from Pakistan was neutralised around 2:30 am on Tuesday along the international India-Pakistan border in Jammu. The official added he continued approaching the fence even after warnings from BSF. Meanwhile, another intruder was apprehended in the Ramgarh sector of J&K. "Nothing incriminating was found from him," BSF said.

271.title: EV startup Faraday Future doubts if it'll continue operating over 2023
271.article_body: EV startup Faraday Future has raised "substantial doubt" on whether it would be able to continue operating over the next year, filings revealed. It's also uncertain when it will dispatch the first deliveries of FF 91 luxury EVs. The startup's stock has plunged about 94% so far this year. It closed out the third quarter with $31.76 million in cash.

272.title: I would like to be the one to give a checkmate against Messi: Ronaldo
272.article_body: In a press conference, Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo said he'd like to be the one to give a checkmate against Argentina captain Lionel Messi. "Let’s see. It'd be beautiful [to win 2022 FIFA World Cup]...As it happened in chess, it'd be magic to happen in football as well," he stated. Portugal’s first group match is against Ghana on Thursday.

273.title: We are still hiring: TikTok CEO amid layoffs by major tech companies
273.article_body: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew at a recent event said the China-based social media company is still hiring, but at a measured pace. The statement comes as major tech companies including Meta, Amazon and Twitter have laid off staff in the recent weeks. TikTok is currently in the middle of a three-year hiring push to add about 3,000 engineers worldwide.

274.title: Man seen massaging Satyendar Jain in Tihar jail in viral video is rape accused: Report
274.article_body: The man giving massage to jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in a viral video is Rinku, a prisoner in a rape case, charged under POCSO Act and IPC sections 376, 506 and 509, ANI reported quoting Tihar Jail official sources. He's not a physiotherapist, officials told ANI. This comes after AAP claimed Jain was receiving physiotherapy for a spinal injury.

275.title: Delhi Police moves court for conducting polygraph test on Aftab
275.article_body: Delhi Police has moved a court seeking permission for conducting the polygraph test on Aftab Poonawala, accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar and chopping her body into 35 pieces. Police had earlier told the court that Aftab is giving wrong information and misleading the investigation. Last week, the court allowed police to conduct a narco-analysis test on Aftab.

276.title: Got asthma attack when SRK was about to die in 'Kal Ho…': Mismatched actor
276.article_body: 'Mismatched' actor Abhinav Sharma recalled that at the age of 13-14, when he was watching 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', he got "an asthma attack when Shah Rukh Khan was about to die". He remembered that he and his family missed the ending of the film, which had upset his mother. The actor also spoke about his affection for Shah Rukh.

277.title: As a human, I'd like Argentina to lose all WC matches: Messi's ex-doctor
277.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi's former doctor Diego Schwarzstein said he'd like to see Argentina lose every match in the 2022 FIFA World Cup and get eliminated in the first round, as a "human being". "Why? I am convinced that this obscenely populist government that we have here would use the success of Argentina...to cover things up," added Schwarzstein.

278.title: Social media commentator arrested for comments against MK Stalin
278.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police arrested a political commentator, Kishore Swamy, for allegedly putting out tweets against CM MK Stalin on Chennai rain situation. He was arrested after his anticipatory bail plea was dismissed by the sessions court. "We sent him four notices but he failed to respond. We took him into our custody from Puducherry on Monday," a police officer said.

279.title: GHMC to establish 16 more multi-purpose function halls in Hyderabad
279.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has proposed to establish 16 more multi-purpose function halls in Hyderabad in addition to the existing list of nine taking the total number to 25. The total 25 function halls will cost ₹95.70 crore. These function halls will have all facilities needed for weddings like separate rooms for brides and grooms, dining area etc.

280.title: Kanye West says he's selling Adidas, Gap hoodies for $20 after firms cut ties with him
280.article_body: Giving a tour of his Los Angeles workshop, rapper Kanye West said he'll be selling hoodies from Balenciaga, Adidas, and Gap for $20. These fashion brands had cut ties with the rapper following his antisemitic comments. In the tour video, many clothes were seen labelled "Ye24", as West also confirmed his intention to run for the 2024 presidential race.

281.title: Delhi court extends Aftab Poonawala's police custody by 4 days
281.article_body: The Saket court in Delhi extended the police custody of Aftab Amin Poonawala by four days on Tuesday. Aftab is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in May and cutting her body into pieces. He was produced before the court in a special hearing and reportedly told the court that the incident happened in heat of the moment.

282.title: TV is like comfort food, will never go out of fashion: Rupali Ganguly
282.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Rupali Ganguly said she hasn't "understood" the OTT world and called television similar to "comfort food". She said television will never go out of fashion because unlike some of the content on OTT space, TV can be watched with family members without feeling embarrassed. "A large chunk of our population...still not gone into the OTT zone," she said.

283.title: Nykaa stock falls over 3% after Lighthouse India stake sale report
283.article_body: The shares of Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Limited fell over 3% on Tuesday after reports of nearly 1.8 crore shares worth ₹320 crore changing hands in a block deal. Private equity firm Lighthouse India has reportedly sold the shares at a price of around ₹183.5 apiece. The shares amount to nearly 0.65% of Nykaa's overall stake.

284.title: Income Tax Dept raids several places linked to Telangana Labour Minister Malla Reddy
284.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Tuesday conducted raids at various locations belonging to the Telangana Labour Minister Chamakura Malla Reddy and his associates for alleged tax evasion. Reports said that searches are underway at several places in Rangareddy district of Hyderabad. Raids are also being conducted at locations linked to Reddy's son and son-in-law, Times Now reported.

285.title: Air India looking to hire foreign pilots for wide-body planes: Report
285.article_body: Air India plans to hire foreign pilots for its wide-body Boeing 777 planes amid a shortage of pilots as the airline is looking to expand its fleet as well as international operations, PTI reported citing sources. The Tata Group-owned airline has reportedly approached various agencies that provide expat flight crew as it looks to rope in around 100 pilots.

286.title: Farmers hit by rains shouldn't be forced to repay power bills: Maha Dy CM
286.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said on Monday that he has ordered officials of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) to not force farmers to repay power bills, especially those who have lost their crops due to excess rains. "However, officials have been asked to collect the electricity bills from farmers for the current season only," he added.

287.title: Kanye tweets 'Shalom', Israel reacts; Musk says 'More countries should tweet like this'
287.article_body: Kanye West, who was banned from Twitter over anti-Semitic remarks, tweeted, "Shalom" on his return, to which Israel responded, "We'd very much like to be excluded from this narrative." Israel's response was a reference to Taylor Swift's statement after Kanye released 'Famous', wherein he calls her 'b***h'. Elon Musk tweeted, "Your tweets are good! More countries should tweet like this."

288.title: 72 kg of narcotics, drugs seized by authorities ahead of MCD polls
288.article_body: Ahead of the municipal polls in Delhi, authorities enforcing the model code of conduct have seized 72 kg of narcotics and drugs, officials said on Monday. "Also, 2,738 bottles of illegal liquor were seized, taking the cumulative figure to 96,085," an official statement read. MCD polls are due on December 4.

289.title: Live classes lead to hands-on learning: Scaler
289.article_body: Instructor-led live classes create an active learning environment vs self-study done online through pre-recorded lectures, said Scaler. It helps learners understand complex concepts more clearly, resolve doubts, interact with peers and apply learning in real time, Scaler shared. This combined with real-world case studies makes them become one of the most valued tech talents in the world, it added.

290.title: I'm perfectly fine, sustained minor injuries: 'Taarak...' actor Amit
290.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Amit Bhatt, who recently got injured on the sets of the television show, has said that he's "perfectly fine". "All the claims suggesting that I have met with a tragic accident are false," he said, adding that he sustained "very minor injuries". He shared his health update on his Instagram profile.

291.title: Pune to get 2 new crematoriums for pet, stray and zoo animals
291.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to set up two new crematoriums for pet, stray and zoo animals, in addition to the existing one. "We have identified two places - one at the Katraj zoo and the other at Bavdhan," said an official. "The PMC is providing the land while the state government is funding the crematoriums," he added.

292.title: Else can break hearts: HC as it allows marriage hall to host functions
292.article_body: The Nagpur bench of Bombay HC recently protected a marriage hall from action by Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB), saying that if scheduled functions don't take place at the venue, it can break the hearts of the bride and groom. The hall was under the scanner for not complying with rules. MPCB was asked to restore electricity and water supply.

293.title: 8 killed as small plane crashes into residential area in Colombia
293.article_body: A small plane carrying eight people crashed into a residential area of Colombia's second-largest city Medellin on Monday, killing all on board, authorities said. The aircraft had reportedly hit at least one house in the Belen Rosales area. The plane took off from the Olaya Herrera Airport in the morning and had reported an engine failure before crashing.

294.title: I was screaming, I said 'Can you please get my wife?': Glenn Maxwell on breaking leg
294.article_body: Recalling the moment he broke his leg during a friend's 50th birthday party, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said, "I heard and felt every part of it." He added, "I was screaming a bit and [my friend] was like, 'Please tell me you're joking'." Maxwell stated, "I said, 'I'm pretty sure both the bones are broken...Can you please get my wife?'"

295.title: How much compensation will Bob Iger receive as Disney CEO?
295.article_body: Bob Iger, who has been named as CEO of The Walt Disney Company for next two years, will receive about $27 million annually as compensation. Iger will receive a base salary of $1 million and a bonus equal to that amount, the company said. In addition, he will receive stock awards with a target value of $25 million each year.

296.title: Mumbai's trans-harbour line to get one more station next year
296.article_body: The trans-harbour railway line that runs between Thane and Panvel will have a new station, Digha, which will be a part of this route in January next year, a Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MRVC) official said. The new station will come after Airoli and will also be part of the proposed Airoli-Kalwa elevated suburban corridor on the Central Railway line.

297.title: Bowl to the other guy: Ross Taylor on how to stop Suryakumar from scoring
297.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Ross Taylor, on being asked how New Zealand bowlers can stop Suryakumar Yadav from scoring, said, "Bowl to the other guy as much as you can." He added, "Suryakumar was hitting sixes at the MCG...if he hits it like that at McLean Park, they will be out of the ground." Suryakumar scored century in second NZ T20I.

298.title: Voters in Maha border districts get 1-day paid leave for Guj polls
298.article_body: The Maharashtra government has issued a government resolution allowing one-day paid leave for voters in border districts, like Palghar, Nashik, Nandurbar and Dhule, for Gujarat Assembly elections. "All private companies are instructed to follow this. If the order is violated, action will be taken," it said. Elections will be held in Gujarat in two phases on December 1 and 5.

299.title: 19 trains cancelled, 20 diverted after train derailment in Odisha
299.article_body: The Indian Railways cancelled 19 trains and diverted 20 others after a goods train derailed at Korai railway station in Odisha on Monday. In addition, six trains were partially cancelled. Three people were killed and four injured in the incident. The Railways arranged free road transportation for stranded passengers at Haridaspur station.

300.title: Rainbow-coloured bucket hats of female Wales fans confiscated at Qatar World Cup
300.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing pro-LGBTQ rainbow-coloured bucket hats of female Wales fans being confiscated upon their entry into the stadium for Wales-USA's 2022 FIFA World Cup match in Qatar. The Football Association of Wales is investigating the matter. "It's a shame," Wales manager Rob Page said.

301.title: World's richest man Musk's wealth drops by over $100 billion for 1st time
301.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk’s wealth declined by over $100 billion for the first time in 2022 as Tesla shares dropped to the lowest level since November 2020. Currently, Tesla CEO Musk's net worth stands at $170 billion as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, after peaking at $340 billion a little more than a year ago.

302.title: No plans to file for bankruptcy imminently: Crypto lender Genesis
302.article_body: Days after being forced to suspend customer redemptions following FTX's collapse, cryptocurrency lender Genesis said it has no plans to file for bankruptcy as it continues to have conversations with creditors. "We have no plans to file [for] bankruptcy imminently. Our goal is to resolve the current situation consensually without the need for any bankruptcy filing," a spokesperson said.

303.title: Brazil have 10 dances ready for each match: Raphinha on celebrating goals
303.article_body: Discussing his team's plans with regard to celebrating goals, Brazil and Barcelona footballer Raphinha said, "We already have dances prepared...till the 10th goal." "We have...10 dances prepared for each match...If we score more than 10...we will have to start innovating," added Raphinha. Brazil will face Serbia in their opening match of the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

304.title: BJP's allegations against AAP won't impact MCD polls: Atishi
304.article_body: AAP's Atishi said BJP’s corruption charge against her party won't impact voters in the Delhi civic polls. On being asked about the impact of BJP’s allegation that CM Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP was shielding Delhi ministers Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain, Atishi said, "Voters know the truth, they're not fools. The allegations levelled by BJP are not going to impact them."

305.title: Factory fire kills 36 in China; 'criminal suspects' arrested
305.article_body: At least 36 people have been killed and two others are missing after a fire broke out at a plant of a trading firm in central China, local authorities said on Tuesday. The fire, which started on Monday afternoon, took four hours to extinguish. "Criminal suspects" had been taken into custody in connection with the fire, authorities added.

306.title: Varun doesn't say bye on call, he says 'I'll call back'; call never comes: Kriti
306.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that actor Varun Dhawan does not say bye on call. "[He] only [says] 'Okay I'll just call you back haan'. And the call never comes! It's a very detached conversation at the beginning and the end. Like, sometimes, he won't say bye and he will just vanish," she added.

307.title: I steal stories, I don't write them; they're all around you: 'RRR' writer
307.article_body: 'RRR' and 'Baahubali...' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad said he does not write stories, he steals them. "Stories are there around you, be it epics like 'Mahabharat', 'Ramayan' or real-life [incidents], there are stories everywhere. You need to represent it in your unique style," he added. "I always try to create a hunger within the audience for my story," he added.

308.title: French startup Fairmat raises $35 million led by Temasek and CNP
308.article_body: French startup Fairmat, which recycles carbon fiber has secured $35 million in a Series A funding round led by Temasek and CNP (Compagnie Nationale à Portefeuille). The funding round also saw participation from Pictet Group, Singular and The Friedkin Group International, among others. The startup, founded by Benjamin Saada, has raised $45.5 million since its inception.

309.title: Centre invites bids to construct MP Chambers near new Parliament
309.article_body: The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) invited pre-qualification bids from companies for construction of MP Chambers that would have offices for all MPs as a part of redevelopment of Central Vista area. The project, estimated to cost ₹1,435 crore, would be spread over 1.18 lakh square metres in two 10-storied buildings, one two-storied building and a ground-floor utility block.

310.title: Tsunami warning issued after 7.0 magnitude earthquake hits Solomon Islands
310.article_body: A 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Solomon Islands on Tuesday, following which a tsunami warning was issued for an area of the Solomon coast within 300 kilometres of the epicentre. Eyewitnesses claimed that the shaking lasted for around 20 seconds, while some reported that the shaking hurled televisions and other items to the ground.

311.title: Iger announces Disney media sales head's exit a day after returning as CEO
311.article_body: A day after returning to The Walt Disney Company, CEO Bob Iger told employees that he would begin making operational changes at the company. Iger announced that one of the first steps would be the departure of Kareem Daniel, the Chairman of Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution. He was a long-time associate of former CEO Bob Chapek.

312.title: Single parent, divorced women are looked down upon: Malaika Arora
312.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora shared that divorced women or women who are a single parent are "looked down upon" and receive "criticism" from society. "There's someone or the other having some sort of comment and I think we need to change that," she added. Malaika said that her upcoming debut OTT series 'Moving In With Malaika' will not be scripted.

313.title: We have to be better: England coach Southgate after 6-2 win vs Iran
313.article_body: England manager Gareth Southgate said his team will have to perform "better" in their upcoming matches of the 2022 FIFA World Cup, having recorded a 6-2 win against Iran. "I am...fed up with the end of it really...It was a sticky first half...I have got to be happy but we shouldn't be conceding two goals at that stage," added Southgate.

314.title: Mumbai records coldest November day in 5 years, temperature drops to 17°C﻿
314.article_body: Mumbai recorded the coldest November day in the last five years on Monday. The temperature dropped to 17 degrees Celsius, four degrees below normal. "The dip in temperature is a result of cold northerly winds. However, easterlies from the Bay of Bengal will lead to moisture incursion and therefore temperatures are likely to rise slightly," said an IMD official.

315.title: Delhi BJP suspends 11 rebel candidates from the party for 6 years
315.article_body: Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta has suspended 11 rebel candidates from party. The rebel candidates are reportedly contesting upcoming MCD polls against official party candidates. Amongst the suspended BJP rebels are Gajendra Daral, Lovelesh Sharma, Reenu Jain, Shama Agarwal, Virendra Agarwal, Ravindra Singh, Antim Gehlot, Poonam Choudhary, Mahavir Singh, Dharamveer Singh and Rajkumar Khurana.

316.title: Journalist detained for wearing rainbow t-shirt to FIFA World Cup stadium in Qatar
316.article_body: American journalist Grant Wahl said he was briefly detained on Monday when was entering a FIFA World Cup stadium in Qatar while wearing a rainbow shirt in support of the LGBTQ community. Sharing a picture on Twitter, he wrote that he was asked to change his t-shirt. "I'm OK...Am in the media center, still wearing my shirt," he later tweeted.

317.title: Truck driver accused in 48 car-pileup incident on Pune highway arrested
317.article_body: Pune Police has arrested the absconding truck driver, who had allegedly turned off the ignition on a downward slope on the Pune-Bengaluru highway to save fuel causing a pileup of nearly 48 vehicles on Sunday. Along with the driver Maniram Yadav, his aide  Lalit Yadav was also arrested, police added. Twenty-four vehicles were significantly damaged in the incident.

318.title: Karisma & Abhishek weren't 'made for each other' kind: Suneel Darshan
318.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan said that Abhishek Bachchan and Karisma Kapoor, who were engaged to each other, "were really not the 'made for each other' kind" pair. The filmmaker added that there was "constant bickering" among them during 'Haan...Maine Bhi Pyaar Kiya', which is their only film together. Abhishek-Karisma reportedly broke up after the film's failure at the box office.

319.title: Ukrainians likely to live with blackouts until March-end: Energy provider
319.article_body: Ukrainians will most likely live with blackouts until at least March-end, the head of a major Ukrainian energy provider said. Workers are rushing to complete repairs before the winter cold arrives, Sergey Kovalenko, CEO of YASNO energy company, added. Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy had said half of the country's energy infrastructure has been damaged by Russian attacks.

320.title: ₹8.93 lakh cash stolen from petrol pump in Pune
320.article_body: An unidentified person allegedly stole ₹8.93 lakh cash from a petrol pump in Pune's Chikhali between 10.30 pm on Saturday and 6 am on Sunday. The staffers of the petrol pump had reportedly collected and stored the money in the cash room but the sum was missing from the locker in the morning.

321.title: AAP MLA thrashed over MCD polls ticket distribution issue, video surfaces
321.article_body: Matiala AAP MLA Gulab Singh Yadav was thrashed allegedly by party workers on Monday in Delhi, a video of which has surfaced. Police said there was an altercation over the issue of ticket distribution which resulted in the alleged manhandling of Yadav by some party workers. The clip shows Yadav running to save himself and angry people following him.

322.title: SUV crashes through window of Apple store in US; 1 dead, 16 injured
322.article_body: An SUV crashed through the front window of an Apple store on Monday in Massachusetts, killing one person and injuring 16 others. The car is said to have gone straight to the back of the store, pinning some shoppers and employees against the wall. Meanwhile, Apple released a statement saying it was "devastated by the shocking events".

323.title: Speeding car rams into 3 vehicles in Pune's Chakan; 3 injured
323.article_body: Three people were injured after a speeding car rammed into two bikes and a car coming from the opposite direction in Pune's Chakan. The car driver escaped from the spot after the accident. Prima facie, police suspect it may be a case of drink and drive. One of the injured people was critically wounded and was taken to a hospital.

324.title: Saudi Arabia executed 12 people in 10 days by sword after 2-year break: Reports
324.article_body: Saudi Arabia executed 12 people in 10 days, most of which were beheadings with a sword, for drug offences after a two-year hiatus, said reports. Those executed reportedly included three Pakistanis, four Syrians, two Jordanians and three Saudis. With this the total number of people executed this year is at least 132, those of 2020 and 2021 combined, AFP reported.

325.title: You can't give bullsh*t to audience, need 3-4 Drishyams to revive B'wood: Ajay
325.article_body: While talking about reviving Bollywood from the box office slump, actor Ajay Devgn said that the industry needs three to four Drishyams. "I feel it is not very easy to make entertaining films...you have to keep the audiences engaged for two and a half hours. And audiences have become very smart, so you can't just give them bullsh*t," he added.

326.title: Twitter is done with layoffs & is actively hiring again, Musk tells staff: Report
326.article_body: Elon Musk has told employees that Twitter is done with layoffs and is actively recruiting for roles in engineering and sales, as per a report. Musk’s comments were reportedly made the same day that an unspecified number of jobs were cut from Twitter’s sales department. Musk also said that Twitter's headquarters won’t be moved from San Francisco, the report added.

327.title: Musk pauses relaunch of $8 per month Twitter blue tick verification plan
327.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Tuesday announced that the social media platform is holding off the relaunch of Twitter Blue "until there is high confidence of stopping impersonation". Twitter recently announced the blue tick subscription service, which costs $8 per month for a verification badge. Musk added that Twitter will probably use different colour check for organisations and individuals.

328.title: BMC sanctions ₹571 crore to reconstruct 2 bridges in Mumbai
328.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has sanctioned ₹571 crore for the reconstruction of two bridges which were declared unsafe in Mumbai. While ₹196 crore has been sanctioned for Reay Road bridge, ₹375 crore has been sanctioned for Tilak bridge. The Reay Road bridge has already been demolished while Tilak bridge will be demolished after the construction of the new bridge.

329.title: Had country-made liquor: Driver of truck that killed 12 in Bihar's Vaishali
329.article_body: The driver of a truck that killed 12 people in Bihar's Vaishali said that he had consumed country-made liquor at a stop. He told news agency ANI that the accident happened when he attempted to overtake another truck. There were children amongst the deceased, reports said, adding that they had gathered to offer prayers to a deity.

330.title: Rumours of bomb at Charminar surface as anti-sabotage checking conducted
330.article_body: Rumours of a bomb at Hyderabad's Charminar surfaced on Monday after the Bomb Disposal and Detection Squad of the Hyderabad Police conducted an anti-sabotage check. Reports said that three teams of the bomb squad, along with sniffer dogs, reached Charminar on Monday and checked the inside and the surroundings of the monument for an hour.

331.title: Gurugram civic body maps 300 garbage vulnerable points across city
331.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has mapped 300 garbage vulnerable points that have turned into dump yards across the city. This comes after MCG asked Ecogreen to only collect segregated waste from Monday. Some people have refused to segregate waste citing long working hours and lack of house help and are throwing waste in open areas, an MCG official said.

332.title: I can't think of a worse curse than living forever: World's richest man Elon Musk
332.article_body: The world's richest man, Elon Musk, tweeted, "I can't think of a worse curse than living forever." His tweet came in response to a person's tweet about the logarithmic timeline of an expanding universe. Several Twitter users reacted to the conversation, with one saying, "With the way the world's going, living just another 200 years might be pretty awful."

333.title: Elon Musk fires more employees from Twitter's sales team: Report
333.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk has fired more employees from the company's sales side, Bloomberg reported. The latest layoffs come after Musk asked Twitter's employees to commit to his more "hardcore" version of the company or leave. According to reports, sales employees signed on to Musk's vision in greater numbers than workers on the technical side, which saw mass resignations.

334.title: USA, Wales deliver first draw of 2022 FIFA World Cup as match ends 1-1
334.article_body: USA and Wales played out the first draw of 2022 FIFA World Cup as their opening match of the tournament ended in a 1-1 draw. USA's Tim Weah opened the scoring in the match in the 36th minute. Wales captain Gareth Bale equalised in the 82nd minute by converting a penalty following a foul by USA defender Walker Zimmerman.

335.title: Germany offers Eurofighters, Patriot air defence system to Poland
335.article_body: Germany has offered Eurofighter combat jets and Patriot air defence missiles to Poland to help secure its airspace, as per German news reports published on Monday. This comes after a missile hit a Polish village near the Ukrainian border last week. The missile appeared to have been fired by Ukraine's air defences rather than a Russian strike, NATO had said.

336.title: Want to be the best and win every tournament in tennis: Djokovic
336.article_body: Novak Djokovic said he is driven by his love and passion for the sport and he wants to "win every tournament". "Why not try it? Why not dream about it? I want to be the best...I don't think that's not humble," said Djokovic. The 21-time Grand Slam champion beat Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-3 to win his sixth ATP Finals title.

337.title: Regret the comments I made against Verstappen after Brazilian Grand Prix: Perez
337.article_body: Red Bull driver Sergio Perez said he regrets the comments he made against teammate Max Verstappen after the Brazilian Grand Prix. "I am back with Max in the relationship we used to have...we could have handled the situation better," said Perez. Current world champion Verstappen had refused to allow Perez to pass him and gain points during the race.

338.title: Made all mistakes we could during the Abu Dhabi GP: Mercedes F1 boss
338.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff said his team made "all the mistakes you can make" during the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "That was really not good...Third quickest...It was a precise summary of the season, and here we are," said Wolff. British driver George Russell finished fifth in the race, while Lewis Hamilton had to retire due to mechanical failure.

339.title: Won't allow Haryana govt new assembly building in Chandigarh: AAP
339.article_body: The AAP said Punjab has sole rights over Chandigarh and Haryana will not be allowed to construct an additional legislative assembly building in the city. "Haryana will not be given an inch of land in Chandigarh," said AAP. Haryana has sought a 10-acre plot adjacent to the traffic light at Madhya Marg in the city for the new assembly building.

340.title: India stands in solidarity: Jaishankar as 162 killed in Indonesia earthquake
340.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, expressing grief over the loss of lives in Indonesia's West Java after an earthquake, on Monday tweeted, "India stands in solidarity with Indonesia at this difficult time." "My thoughts are with the bereaved families. Wish the injured [persons] a speedy recovery," he added. The 5.6-magnitude earthquake led to the loss of at least 162 lives.

341.title: Man who threatened to kill Rahul Gandhi in MP identified: Police
341.article_body: Police said they have identified the man who threatened to kill Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Kamal Nath and carry out blasts when the Bharat Jodo Yatra goes to Indore. Police said the man moves around like a nomad and writes letters from different districts under fake names. Police added that they also had photos of the man.

342.title: Fans unable to access tickets after FIFA's ticketing app crashes
342.article_body: Thousands of fans were unable to access tickets to the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar after FIFA's ticketing app crashed. Tickets on the app "disappeared" from accounts and we were unable to transfer tickets to other individuals accompanying us, an affected fan said. Fans were then instructed to reach Ticket Resolution Points, causing long lines.

343.title: Book tickets for Ram Mandir inauguration: Amit Shah to Rahul Gandhi
343.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to book tickets for the inauguration of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya. "Nobody had the guts to (rebuild it) since Babar destroyed it. It is...(PM) Narendra Modi who laid the foundation stone," said Shah. He added that Pakistani infiltrators "used to take the heads of our jawans" during the UPA regime.

344.title: CA Swift Investments sells 2.5% stake in Delhivery for ₹607 crore
344.article_body: CA Swift Investments offloaded a 2.5% stake in supply chain company Delhivery for ₹607.38 crore through the open market transaction. According to official data, CA Swift Investments sold 18.4 million shares at an average price of ₹330.02 apiece. Morgan Stanley picked up about 4.9 million shares for ₹160 crore, data provided by stock exchanges showed.

345.title: Injured owl rescued by forest dept handed over to Lucknow zoo
345.article_body: An injured mottled wood owl rescued by forest department officials was handed over to the Lucknow zoo. The bird was injured at Scooter India crossing in Lucknow's Sarojini Nagar area and the city police informed the forest department about it. A team was sent by Divisional Forest Officer Ravi Kumar Singh to rescue the owl and arrange for its treatment.

346.title: Khalistani terrorist carrying ₹5 lakh reward arrested by NIA
346.article_body: Most-wanted Khalistani terrorist Kulwinderjit Singh alias Khanpuria was arrested at the Delhi airport after he arrived from Bangkok, an official from the National Investigation Agency (NIA) said. Singh has been associated with terror outfits such as Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) and the Khalistan Liberation Force (KLF). He was carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh, the official added.

347.title: Punjab govt treating cases of illicit liquor trade with 'kids' glove': SC
347.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said Punjab government is treating cases of illicit liquor trade in the state "with kids' glove". It appears no serious efforts have been made to reach the real culprits who're in business of manufacturing and transporting illicit liquor, SC said. SC also directed the government to inform it of details concerning FIRs lodged in this regard.

348.title: 25-yr-old social media influencer 'Rowdy Bhati' dies in car crash in Gr Noida
348.article_body: A 25-year-old social media celebrity whose Instagram name is 'Rowdy Bhati' has died in a car crash in Greater Noida, police said on Monday. Rohit Bhati, who was from UP's Bulandshahr, was killed after the car he and two of his friends were in, crashed into a tree. His friends are undergoing treatment at hospitals in Greater Noida and Delhi.

349.title: This Argentina team reminds me that of 2014 squad: Messi ahead of WC opener
349.article_body: Ahead of Argentina against Saudi Arabia match in FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar, Argentina captain Lionel Messi said his current team reminds him of the 2014 squad.
