"It was a very similar strong squad. We were very united, we were very clear about what we had to do on a pitch," he added. Messi-led Argentina finished runners-up in 2014.

350.title: Nothing surprising: Jaffer on Ishan's selection over Gill in 2nd T20I vs NZ
350.article_body: While justifying Ishan Kishan's selection over Shubman Gill in India's playing XI for second T20I against New Zealand, Wasim Jaffer said it's "nothing surprising". "Because Ishan played T20Is before...he did well, so it makes sense to give him a go," he added. Before the second T20I, Kishan had played in 19 T20Is. Gill is yet to make his T20I debut.

351.title: 75-yr-old man killed, another injured over land dispute in Madhya Pradesh
351.article_body: A 75-year-old man was killed and another person was injured after being allegedly attacked by a group of people over a land dispute in Atrar village in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district. The son of the deceased, Ghanshyam Mishra, alleged that his father was attacked with sticks. The main accused has been identified as Ram Narayan Mishra, police said.

352.title: Gunmen abduct over 100 people from 4 villages in northwest Nigeria
352.article_body: More than 100 people, including women and children, were abducted by gunmen from four villages in Nigeria's northwestern Zamfara state on Sunday, authorities and residents said. Such mass abductions by armed groups are said to have become endemic in northwest Nigeria. Zamfara's Information Minister Ibrahim Dosara accused the gunmen of using abductees as human shields against military air strikes.

353.title: Farah Khan, Johny Lever attend Tabassum's prayer meet in Mumbai
353.article_body: Several celebrities from the film industry, including Farah Khan, Johny Lever and Jaaved Jaaferi, attended the prayer meeting held in honour of late actress Tabassum on Monday. Neil Nitin Mukesh, Moushumi Chatterjee, Alka Yagnik and Raza Murad also paid their last respects to the actress. Tabassum passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest.

354.title: Top Russian official warns of possible nuclear mishap at Zaporizhzhia
354.article_body: Russian state-run atomic energy agency Rosatom's chief warned on Monday that there was a risk of a nuclear accident at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant following renewed shelling over the weekend. Alexei Likhachev further said it appeared Kyiv was willing to "accept" a "small nuclear accident". Moscow and Kyiv have accused each other of shelling the plant for months now.

355.title: 95% of players would agree Messi is the greatest player: Croatia's Kramaric
355.article_body: Croatia forward Andrej Kramaric said he will be cheering for Argentina in ongoing FIFA World Cup 2022 as no one will ever see a player like Lionel Messi again. "I think 95% of players would agree Messi is the greatest player ever to play this game," he added. Kramaric stated that he thinks Brazil will win the tournament.

356.title: Big things await: Karthik on Jagadeesan's record-breaking 277 in 50-over match
356.article_body: Reacting to Tamil Nadu wicketkeeper-opener Narayan Jagadeesan's record-breaking knock in men's List A cricket, Dinesh Karthik took to Twitter and wrote, "World record alert. What an amazing effort by Jagadeesan. Couldn't be happier for him. Big things await." Jagadeesan scored 277 runs off 141 balls in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Arunachal Pradesh at M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Monday.

357.title: Beautiful that many people outside Argentina want us to be champions: Messi
357.article_body: Argentina skipper Lionel Messi said it's a beautiful thing that many non-Argentinians want them to be the champions at the FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "I'm grateful for the love I've received...during my career, and here in Qatar, it's another example of that...This is probably my last WC, my last chance to achieve this great dream," Messi said.

358.title: Nicholas Pooran resigns as West Indies ODI and T20I captain
358.article_body: Nicholas Pooran has resigned as West Indies ODI and T20I captain, citing "enormous disappointment" caused by West Indies' exit from T20 World Cup 2022 in first round. "This is not me giving up. I remain ambitious and still view the captaincy...as an honour that is bestowed upon you," he said. Pooran led West Indies in 23 T20Is and 17 ODIs.

359.title: Aamir Khan is a film school, learnt a lot from him: 'Laal...' director
359.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan in an interview called Aamir Khan a "film school" and said that he has learnt a lot from the actor. "Recently I was directing a music video and I was stuck. I thought...how he'd have done it. [He's]...my guru," Advait said, adding, "He genuinely listens and he's open, and that's something...I've tried to become."

360.title: Varun was never on my radar for 'October': Director Shoojit Sircar
360.article_body: Director Shoojit Sircar revealed that Varun Dhawan wasn't on his "radar" for his film 'October'. He added that the actor wanted to work with him. Shoojit further said when Varun came to his office, he was "quite clumsy". "I was looking for...certain kind of that clumsiness...And somehow, he was there and I felt...he was doing the right thing," said Shoojit.

361.title: Anyone can do negative politics but Rahul did positive politics: CM Baghel
361.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that anyone can do negative politics but Congress MP Rahul Gandhi did positive politics. CM Baghel further added that those who used to question Rahul's leadership ability, had their mouths shut. "Today the Chhattisgarh model of Congress is in discussion all over the country, while Gujarat's model has failed," CM Baghel added.

362.title: Pak Army Chief's family members became billionaires in last 6 years: Report
362.article_body: Pakistan Army Chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa's family members became billionaires during his six-year tenure, an investigative report by Pakistani website Fact Focus claimed. The current market value of the known assets and businesses of Bajwas, both within and outside Pakistan, amounts to PKR 12.7 billion. The family members own farmhouses in Pakistan and foreign countries, the report added.

363.title: Cong insults tribals, mocked me for wearing tribal attire: PM Modi
363.article_body: While addressing a rally in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi said that Congress remained unaware of the existence of tribal people. "Even today, Congress leaders make fun of me for wearing tribal attire," the PM said. He added it was the BJP government, which carved out a separate ministry for the tribal people and allocated a budget for their welfare.

364.title: Iran protests like 'popular uprising', no danger to regime yet: Israeli spy chief
364.article_body: Israel's military intelligence chief said on Monday that the anti-government protests in Iran were starting to resemble "a popular uprising" but he could see "no real danger to the regime" thus far. "When you look at...the damage to national institutions, to symbols of the state..., there is something...happening...that is greatly troubling the [Iranian] regime," Major-General Aharon Haliva added.

365.title: 'Kaithi' is one of the most important films in my career: Karthi
365.article_body: Actor Karthi, who recently featured in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', said filming of the sequel to his 2019 film 'Kaithi' will "hopefully" start in 2023. "'Kaithi' is...one of the [most] important films in my career. It came to me as a small idea but the moment I listened to it, I knew it was a big action film," he further added.

366.title: Go from here, says Raj Minister to collector using phone at event
366.article_body: Rajasthan minister Ramesh Meena asked the Bikaner District Collector to "go from" a public event on Monday for being preoccupied with his phone instead of paying attention to issues he was raising. "When a collector does not listen to the minister, how will he listen to the general public and how will their grievances be resolved?" Meena asked.

367.title: Protesting naxals burn 5 vehicles, 4 mobile towers in Chhattisgarh
367.article_body: Naxals set fire to five vehicles and four mobile towers in the Antagarh region of Chhattisgarh on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. The Kanker SP said the Naxals were protesting the death of two Naxalites in an alleged encounter. The extremists also blocked a highway by felling trees and set fire to a JCB, grader, tractor and bus.

368.title: 2 dead as car catches fire after crashing into tractor-trolley in UP
368.article_body: Two persons were charred to death when their car caught fire after crashing into a tractor-trolley, which had already met with an accident, on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. The car was moving towards Agra when it rammed the tractor-trolley, which had collided with a truck. Two other passengers of the car were able to escape to safety.

369.title: I was paid ₹700 for my debut film 'Ankur': Dalip Tahil
369.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil, when asked how much he was paid for his debut film 'Ankur', said, "I think I was paid ₹700." "It was a lot for a low-budget production, funded by NFDC. Shyam Benegal (director) looked after me very well," he added. The film, which was released in 1974, also featured Shabana Azmi and Anant Nag.

370.title: Focus on improving drag-flick, goalkeeping skills: Dilip Tirkey to members
370.article_body: Hockey India President Dilip Tirkey has asked members' units to start work on improving drag-flick and goalkeeping skills at the grassroots level. "Drag-flickers and goalkeepers at the junior level still need vast improvement," Tirkey said. He added, "The drag-flicking technique has become one of the most thrilling aspects...[and] there is a growing importance of having an agile goalkeeper."

371.title: All 9 accused in Morbi bridge collapse case apply for bail
371.article_body: All nine accused in the Morbi bridge collapse case that killed 135 people, including 55 children, have applied for bail. The latest bail application, moved on November 19, was by Devang Parmar of Dev Prakash Fabrication, the firm sub-contracted by Oreva for the bridge's restoration. Parmar's father Prakash was the first to apply for bail on November 11.

372.title: Pak's 'enemy' agencies after Imran Khan's life: Interior Minister
372.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah has said that the country's former PM Imran Khan faces a threat from "every enemy agency of Pakistan". He added that the entire blame would fall on the Army, ISI, PM Shehbaz Sharif, and Sanaullah himself if anything happened to Khan. "If...something happens to him (Imran), he'll be a source of chaos, anarchy," Sanaullah stated.

373.title: British PM Rishi Sunak unveils plan to bring young tech talent to UK
373.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak launched a new programme to identify and attract 100 young talents in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to the country. Pledging to create "one of the world's most attractive visa regimes for entrepreneurs and highly skilled people", he said, "We cannot allow the world's top AI talent to be drawn to America or China."

374.title: Cure to BJP's ailment of being obsessed with Yadav family is defeat: Akhilesh
374.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the cure for BJP's ailment of being obsessed with the Yadav family is defeat by a record margin in the upcoming Mainpuri bypoll. "If we (Yadavs) part ways then false publicity is done that there is a feud in the family. If we stay together, then they cry 'parivaarvaadi' (dynasts)," Akhilesh said.

375.title: Decision on app-based auto services by Nov 25: K'taka govt to HC
375.article_body: The Karnataka government informed the High Court that it will decide on app-based auto-rickshaw services by November 25. Additionally, the state government also asked the court to not decide on rate hikes sought by the service providers till the decision was made. The government told the court that the aggregators were over-charging and not following rates fixed by authorities.

376.title: Iran goalkeeper suffers head injury during FIFA WC match, carried off on stretcher
376.article_body: Iran goalkeeper Alireza Beiranvand suffered a head injury after colliding with his teammate Majid Hosseini during their FIFA World Cup 2022 opener against England. The 30-year-old was carried off the field on a stretcher after spending several minutes on the pitch receiving treatment. He was replaced by Seyed Hossein Hosseini in the 20th minute of the match.

377.title: BJP MLA puts Prez Murmu's photo on bindi to protest against TMC leader
377.article_body: BJP MLA Agnimitra Paul tweeted a picture of herself wearing a bindi with an image of President Droupadi Murmu's picture on it, as a mark of protest against TMC leader Akhil Giri. "The face of the fight of tribal women of India," Paul wrote. In a video, Giri was heard saying, "How does our President look" and was subsequently criticised.

378.title: Air India plans to hire around 100 expat pilots for wide-body planes: Report
378.article_body: Air India plans to hire around 100 expat pilots for its wide-body Boeing 777 planes as it is facing a shortage of pilots, according to a report. The carrier has reportedly approached various agencies that provide expat flight crew to airlines. The report said the plans to expand its fleet and international operations have contributed to airline's pilot shortage.

379.title: We'll miss you: Germany's Zverev to compatriot Vettel on his F1 retirement
379.article_body: German tennis player Alexander Zverev took to Instagram Stories after compatriot Sebastian Vettel's retirement from Formula One and wrote, "We will miss you." Earlier, the four-time F1 world champion wrote, "Thank you for the support, the messages, the letters and all the love." Vettel finished 10th in the final race of his career at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday.

380.title: Maharashtra appoints 2 ministers to oversee border dispute with K'taka
380.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Monday appointed ministers Chandrakant Patil and Shambhuraj Desai to coordinate with the legal team on the border dispute between Maharashtra and Karnataka. The state has appointed senior advocate Vaidyanathan to represent Maharashtra in the case in the Supreme Court. Patil is the higher and technical education minister.

381.title: Smell that made 50 Hyd college students ill came from garbage: Police
381.article_body: Students from Hyderabad's Kasturba Gandhi Degree and PG College for Women, where nearly 50 individuals fell ill due to a foul smell, claimed it was due to a reaction in their chemistry lab. The police stated that the foul smell came from nearby garbage being moved. The college management has reportedly dissuaded students from sharing details of the incident online.

382.title: Don't feel exhausted body-wise in this season's end: Oldest ATP Finals champ Novak
382.article_body: Novak Djokovic, who tied Roger Federer for most ATP Finals titles after lifting his sixth title on Sunday, said body-wise he doesn't feel as exhausted at the end of this season as compared to previous ones. The 35-year-old is the oldest champion in tournament history. Djokovic was seen shaking and gasping for breath against Daniil Medvedev in Red Group match.

383.title: Trolling initially was startling, overwhelming, demoralizing: Malaika
383.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking about social media trolls, said that it affects many people around her. "It affects family and friends. They are human," she stated. Malaika added, "Initially, it did affect me a lot...the initial thing was a bit startling, overwhelming and demoralizing but I think with time you kind of become hardened."

384.title: Varun & I weren't really friends in beginning of 'Dilwale' shoot: Kriti
384.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon, speaking about her friendship with actor Varun Dhawan, said that they both were not really friends at the beginning of the 'Dilwale' shoot. "We became closer friends towards the end of the shoot," she added. Both worked together in 'Dilwale' for the first time. The duo will share the screen in the upcoming film 'Bhediya'.

385.title: Cong oblivious to the existence of tribals in India: PM Modi
385.article_body: PM Narendra Modi alleged that Congress leaders are oblivious to the existence of tribals despite tribals living in the country since Lord Ram and Lord Krishna. "Congress leaders never knew that Adivasis exist...It was Ataljee's government...which carved out a separate ministry...for their welfare," PM added. He also said that Adivasis cannot expect Congress to improve their condition.

386.title: 3 more countries at risk of currency crisis after Pakistan, Sri Lanka: Nomura
386.article_body: Financial holding company Nomura Holdings has said that the Czech Republic, Romania and Hungary face the risk of exchange-rate crises over the next year as fiscal and external challenges mount. The warning is based on an analysis of eight indicators including foreign exchange reserves and real short-term interest rates. Egypt, Sri Lanka, Turkey and Pakistan have already experienced such crises.

387.title: Death toll in Indonesia earthquake rises to 162; over 13,000 people displaced
387.article_body: The death toll from a 5.6-magnitude earthquake in Indonesia on Monday has risen to 162, regional governor Ridwan Kamil said. Over 13,000 people have been displaced due to the earthquake, Kamil added. Further, more than 2,200 homes have been damaged. The epicentre of the earthquake was located near the West Java town of Cianjur.

388.title: Hockey WC 1998 is one of best tournaments I've ever played: Ex-Dutch skipper
388.article_body: Ex-Dutch skipper Stephan Veen said that the men's hockey World Cup 1998 in Netherlands' Utrecht is one of the best tournaments he has ever played in. "Playing for your home crowd is the best thing you can experience...People are still talking about that tournament...They transformed a soccer stadium into a field hockey stadium [in Utrecht]," 52-year-old Veen said.

389.title: Work on Hyd's Shilpa flyover completed, to be inaugurated soon
389.article_body: The four-lane bi-directional flyover from Shilpa Layout- Outer Ring Road (ORR) near Gachibowli Junction in Hyderabad has been completed. Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Gadwal Vijayalaxmi, along with other officials, visited the flyover on Monday. Reports claim the project, which comes under the Strategic Road Development Plan, will be open to the public by November end.

390.title: Govt norms against fake reviews on e-commerce sites to kick in Nov 25
390.article_body: The Centre announced new guidelines to curb fake online reviews and ratings which will come into effect from November 25. E-commerce platforms have to voluntarily disclose all paid consumer reviews of products and services offered by them. The government barred reviews that "have been purchased and/or written by individuals employed for that purpose by the supplier or third party concerned".

391.title: Plea in HC seeks CBI probe in Shraddha Walkar's murder case
391.article_body: Advocate Joshini Tuli has filed a plea in Delhi High Court seeking transfer of probe in Shraddha Walkar's murder case from Delhi Police to CBI. The plea said the investigation by police "cannot be efficiently carried out due to administrative/staff paucity". The plea further stated that the crime scenes are being contaminated by public and media personnel on daily basis.

392.title: Punish parents of rapists, murderers too along with convicts: BJP MLA
392.article_body: BJP MLA from Madhya Pradesh, Akash Vijayvargiya, on Monday said parents of rapists and murderers must also be punished for at least one to three years along with their convicted children.  "It's the parents' lookout to make their children responsible citizens with good character and culture...If they do something bad, parents are responsible for it," Vijayvargiya said.

393.title: Suryakumar's 111* is one of the best I've seen in New Zealand: Taylor
393.article_body: Calling Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 111(51) in Mount Maunganui "unbelievable", ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor said the India batter's innings in the second T20I is one of the best he has seen on New Zealand soil. "He takes calculated risks...he played really good cricketing shots," Ross added. Suryakumar hit 11 fours and seven sixes during his second T20I ton.

394.title: No action against Morbi tragedy culprits as they're linked to BJP: Rahul
394.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said no action has been taken against the "real culprits" behind last month's collapse of a suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi. "Will nothing happen to them because they share a good relationship with the BJP?" he added. "They arrested chowkidars (watchmen) and put them behind bars," Gandhi further said.

395.title: Satyendar Jain has lost 28 kg since being jailed: His lawyers
395.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain's lawyers have alleged that Tihar jail authorities have stopped providing him food items as per his religious beliefs and he has lost 28 kg since being jailed. His lawyers said Jain isn't having cooked food, pulses, grains and milk products since he isn't able to visit temple. Jain is in custody in a money laundering case.

396.title: Twitter users troll 'Adipurush' over VFX of 'HanuMan', say 'It's so much better'
396.article_body: Several Twitter users trolled the VFX of Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan's 'Adipurush', which is reportedly made on a reported budget of ₹500 crore, after the teaser of 'HanuMan' was released on Monday. One of the users tweeted, "The VFX...CGI are so much better than 'Adipurush'." 'Adipurush' release was postponed after the film's teaser was trolled over its VFX.

397.title: Raut's 'hypocritical' Hindu attitude is condemnable: BJP's Rane
397.article_body: BJP's Nitesh Rane on Monday said that Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's "hypocritical" Hindu attitude is condemnable. Rane's remark came after Raut lauded Congress' Rahul Gandhi in a tweet, despite his comments on Veer Savarkar. "Now their true love has come out of the pretence. He has real loyalty to those who criticise Savarkar," Rane said.

398.title: L’Oréal appoints Aseem Kaushik as Managing Director for India
398.article_body: L’Oréal has announced the appointment of Aseem Kaushik as the Managing Director for India. He has succeeded Amit Jain, who will retire by the end of this year. Kaushik has been with the company for 27 years and held several leadership positions within the group. Most recently, he led international teams in PPD (Professional Products Division).

399.title: 4 Russian 'torture' sites found in the city of Kherson: Ukraine
399.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General's office on Monday said that it had identified four locations where Russian troops "brutally tortured" people in the recently-liberated city of Kherson. Russian forces set up "pseudo-law enforcement agencies" in detention centres and a police station, it added. Russian officials also allegedly left behind paperwork documenting the functioning of the detention sites.

400.title: It has been a year of many highs and lows: World no. 3 Casper Ruud
400.article_body: Casper Ruud said he has overachieved in 2022 by his own estimation. He won three Tour-level titles this season and reached an additional four finals at ATP Finals, US Open, French Open and Miami Open. "It's been a year of many highs, some really big highs. Of course, some lows," he added. Ruud finished the season at world number three.

401.title: Jindal Steel and Power wins bid to build Botswana's coal power plant
401.article_body: Jindal Steel and Power has been picked by Botswana to build a 300 megawatt coal power plant in the country. Jindal will finance the power plant construction and will recoup investments from selling electricity to the Botswana Power Corporation (BPC), the terms of which are yet to be negotiated. Initially, four companies were shortlisted for the contract.
